 The branch went through the ice and I fell in	 the water closed á

 but I preferred going out for lunch with the accounts personnel á

label: disgust

When we were at home	 my husband and I	 he made a remark about á

text:
Our tutorial group was soon to be divided	 and we got a list of á

read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar á
room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if á
I would succeed as a group leader.
label: fear

text:
We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant.  á
Despite my not knowing why	 I was angry with my companion.  I let á

label: anger

text:
My grandmother died	 and my mother called me one sunday morning á
in the Autumn.  The way my mother told me about it	 I hated her á
at that moment.  She sounded as if she had been waiting for the á
death of my grandmother.  I had lost a person close to me.  I á
felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late.  I had not á
remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.
label: sadness

text:
At the underground station	 a drunkard came to speak to me.  He á

growling man.
label: disgust

text:
I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to be á
done in groups of two.  I was talking about it to my friends when á

work partner.  I did not quite mean what I said and I felt á
ashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is also á
a friend of mine.
label: shame

text:
I had told my boyfriend that I did not want to go on with our á
relationship.  I knew that I was important to him but I wanted to á
be free.  I saw that this was difficult for him but I remained á
firm and did not change my mind.
label: guilt

[ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me	 á

label: anger

text:

exam	 when I actually did not even take it.
label: shame

text:
When I spoke ill of a fellow worker in the absence of this á
person.
label: guilt

text:
When I look at people around and know that people who are stupid á
look stupid.
label: joy

text:
When I saw Russian roulette on TV. (obviously the movie "Deer á
hunter")
label: fear

text: When stupid people push me during rush time in the city.
label: anger

text: [ Laziness makes one sad.]
label: sadness

text:
When I saw hundreds of snakes twisting over one another in a á
movie.
label: disgust

text:
I saw a skid-row (chronical) alcoholic and I was ashamed of the á
people with a high standard of living.
label: shame

text: When I shot a bird in the head with a shotgun.
label: guilt

text: [ Being close to another person.]
label: joy

text: [ Uncertainty about my own abilities in an exam.]
label: fear

text: [ An unfair punishment.]
label: anger

text: Loneliness	 being uncertain of myself in the Autumn.
label: sadness

text: A rich man expressing disgust towards an alcoholic.
label: disgust

text:
A man asked me: "May I sleep in your stairway?"  and I answered á
"No".
label: shame

text: [ The same as in shame.]
label: guilt

text:
I went to a doctor with a complaint. The doctor told me that I á
was completely healthy.
label: joy

text:
My father was away from home and he did not come back when he was á
expected	 he came back several hours later than expected.
label: fear

text:
I had an implicit agreement with my sister about meeting her	 á
however she had not understood the situation the same way so she á
did not turn up.
label: anger

text: I realized that the girl I loved had to leave me.
label: sadness

text:
In the bus I was sitting next to a colleage who was drunk and á
behaved in keeping with his state.
label: disgust

text:
I had promised to help out with domestic chores and I forgot á
about it.
label: shame

text: I had promised to call a girl but I did not do it.
label: guilt

text:
When I unexpectedly received birthday greetings from a person I á
like.
label: joy

text:
I returned home late from a party last night and I felt afraid á
trying to anticipate the reaction of my father.
label: fear

text: When I learned that my brother had spoilt an LP of mine.
label: anger

text:
When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had a á
boyfriend.
label: sadness

text: A too eager approach by a dirty drunken person in a bus.
label: disgust

text:
I made a major mistake while learning how to use a computer programme á
and the teacher criticized me.
label: shame

text:
I reproached my mother's cooking and criticised her á
personality	 and she felt hurt and depressed.
label: guilt

text: I shot the decisive goal in an ice-hockey match.
label: joy

text:
When I got lost in New York city a late friday night with a á
friend of mine.
label: fear

text: After having quarelled with a relative of mine about politics.
label: anger

text: The death of my grandmother.
label: sadness

text:
When I noticed that a nice person was being exploited á
economically.
label: disgust

text: I slandered a person behind his back and he got to know about it.
label: shame

text:
I had quarelled with a friend of mine and I later realized that á
it was also my fault.
label: guilt

text:
I passed an exam which I was not sure at all to pass.  I rejoyced á
at the result because the possibility of continuing my studies á
depended on it.
label: joy

text:
In the traffic with a car	 I nearly got crushed between a bus and á
a tram.  The attention of other drivers saved me at the last moment.
label: fear

text:
I was disappointed and angry at the bad quality of a documentay á
program on TV.  In my opinion	 the topic was important and the á
program should have been made with seriousness and consideration.
label: anger

text:
My father had a heart attack when I was not at home (I was still á
living with them).  He recovered relatively well although he had á
to retire (which implied relief from the stress of a small scale á
enterprise).
label: sadness

text:
At my grandmother's detestable and selfish conduct towards my á
elder sister	 although her behavior was due to senility and lack of á
understanding.
label: disgust

text:
I arrived late at a seminar concerning my major subject at á
university	 although I had been appointed to formally oppose the á
paper which was being presented.
label: shame

text:
I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furniture á
of mine	 but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of mine á
took it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people some á
unnecessary work.
label: guilt

text:
On the cliff by the sea	 the silence and the sudden voice of a á
bird.(swans of the bay)
label: joy

text: A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.
label: fear

text:
When I realized that I was far behind the others in the language á
course and I could no longer catch up with the others.
label: anger

text:
The long lasting illness of my grand-mother	 and the changes in á
family relationships caused by it.
label: sadness

text:
Spoilt	 smashed and molded potatoes in the fridge	 and having to á
clean up the dish later.
label: disgust

text:
A truth expressed unthinkingly at a coffee party.  I realized á
later that I had been inconsiderate	 at a wrong moment and the á
wrong place.
label: shame

text: I did not go to the exercises	 without any adequate reason.
label: guilt

text:
When I got home from my job	 I found a letter from the university á
telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.
label: joy

text:
While watching TV (a war movie)	 I felt a strong fear of death	 á
threat and fear of loosing people close to me.
label: fear

text:
I was angry with a friend of mine who behaved in an affected á
manner.
label: anger

text:
I made a long-distance call to people rather close to me and I á
thought about the sad incident that had happened to them in the á
near past; I knew that they were thinking about it too when I made á
the call.
label: sadness

text:
My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in a á
peculiar manner.
label: disgust

text: When my friend let my personal matters be publicaly known.
label: shame

text:
When I think about my family (parents	 brothers	 sisters) guilt á
is a part of my feelings.
label: guilt

text:
I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well. á
( I had not seen her for several months.)
label: joy

text: When my father was very drunk and raging at home.
label: fear

text:
When I did not find the rack used for beating up rugs	 in the á
yard.
label: anger

text: When one of my cat died of a disease.
label: sadness

text:
I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to my á
student lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which had á
been planned by taking people's comfort into account.
label: disgust

text:
My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I brought á
another girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober I á
felt quite ashamed of myself.
label: shame

text:
I got 100 FIM too much when I changed money at the bank.  They á
soon called me at my job and the situation was embarrasing for á
me.
label: guilt

text:
In Sweden	 a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn. á
 One day	 this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk á
(hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down	 and á
I could not foretell his reactions.  However	 nothing happened.
label: fear

text:
I had an appointment downtown	 and the person in question was á
half an hour late.
label: anger

text: The death of my grandmother.
label: sadness

text:
In the army	 I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as á
I returned to the company	 a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load á
on the tractor trailer.
label: disgust

text:
On the way back from a Summer spent in Sweden	 I drunk with a man á
in the train.  I had drunk so much that when I got home I fell á
asleep in the entrance hall.  I have never drunk that much	 á
neither before nor after that incident.  I was ashamed because my á
mother and my sister had to see me in that state and my father á
had to carry me to bed.
label: shame

text:
While at primary school	 I did not let a friend ring a bell á
although he would have liked to do it.  Afterwards I felt bad.
label: guilt

text: I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.
label: joy

text:
I was jogging in the forest	 in the central park area	 when I saw á
a man hiding behind a tree.  I got frigthened	 turned around and á
ran out of the forest.
label: fear

text:
I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine.  He was á
criticizing my earlier conduct towards him	 which to my mind was á
unfounded.  When I reached home	 I ran out of the taxi and á
slammed the door.
label: anger

text:
I had had a farewell party at the place where I had been working á
for a year.  That night I could not fall off to sleep.  I was sad á
thinking that I would not see my nice fellow workers again.
label: sadness

text:
I was travelling in a local train when a drunkard	 smelling á
terribly	 entered the same carriage and started eating fish that á
was stinking.
label: disgust

text:
While quarelling with a fellow worker of mine	 I was vehement and á
irritated and I told him what I thought of him in plain language.  á
I was ashamed of myself when I met him the next day.
label: shame

text:
I was working as a secretary.  My boss was to go to give a á
lecture	 and wanted me to give him the exact address of the á
place.
label: guilt

text: A sunny Autumn day	 after a long rainy period.
label: joy

text:
Years ago	 on my way to school by the forest path I came across á
an exhibitionist.
label: fear

text:
A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad	 and á
therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.
label: anger

text:
[ A person close to me told me that his positive regard depended á
on my conduct.]
label: sadness

text:
When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to á
approach me.
label: disgust

text:
As a little girl	 I was sick in the middle of a school day and I á
vomitted in the basin of the classroom.
label: shame

text: I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.
label: guilt

text: I got to know that I had been accepted at university.
label: joy

text:
I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.  At á
night I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoids á
were on the move.
label: fear

text:
My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front of á
others.  In fact	 the task in question was not supposed to be á
done by me.
label: anger

text: My father suddenly fell ill and died.
label: sadness

text:
When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my á
other friends and me.
label: disgust

text: When I forgot a promise made to a friend of mine.
label: shame

text:
It was my turn to cook dinner.  I forgot a dish (the favourite of á
the family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.
label: guilt

text:
My joy was the joy of meeting again.  My husband came home after á
having been away for weeks (for work).  I was on the railway á
station to meet him.
label: joy

text:
I was alone at home and I could hear odd noises coming from above á
our bedroom.  I knew that nobody lived there since it was an á
office.  I got frightened (later I was given a "natural" á
explanation).
label: fear

text:
A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to him á
about a problem concerning his sister and me.  I was angry á
because this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me and á
instead spoke to my husband.  I got to know about it later the á
same day.
label: anger

text:
The death of my father	 even though we had not been very close to á
each other.
label: sadness

text:
The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us.  á
I did not like the man.
label: disgust

text:
At school I was talking to a classmate about mathematics.  I had á
grown weary of it and said : "I would like to throw the book on á
the arse of Kuikka".  My classmate said : "Now	 he is sitting á
there and waiting for the book" (Kuikka was one of the most quiet á
boys of the class).  I was ashamed of myself.
label: shame

text:
The death of my father made me feel quite guilty	 because my á
attitude towards him had been cold and indifferent.
label: guilt

text:
My mother	 sister and I were thinking about old times	 our á
childhood	 and we had a very happy time.
label: joy

text:
My husband had gone to drive a strange	 broken car.  At the á
agreed time	 he had not returned	 and I feared that he had had an á
accident.
label: fear

text:
I am a school teacher.  One of the classes does not obey me at all	 á
keeps on talking	 does no work.  One afternoon	 everything went á
wrong	 and I got exceedingly angry.
label: anger

text:
A young	 close relative of mine died	 leaving behind a baby a few á
months old.
label: sadness

text:
A series about Freud was shown on TV.  In it	 a tampon had been á
set in the nose of a woman	 and forgotten there.  After great á
pain it was taken off (close-up picture)	 the woman was bleeding á
from the nose and the mouth.
label: disgust

text:
I had promised to lend something to my mother-in-law and I forgot á
it a couple of times.  When she asked me about it the third time	 á
I was ashamed at my absent-mindedness.
label: shame

text:
A borrowed car broke down while I was using it.  It was not my á
fault	 nevertheless I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text:
I started a new branch of studies after having failed a former á
one.  When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to know á
that I almost had full marks.
label: joy

text:
I was diving below the ice	 in a cave	 at a depth of 26 metres.  á
Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreased á
threateningly.  There were three of us divers on one safety rope.
label: fear

text:
My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something á
which was serious and a real burden to me.
label: anger

text: My grandfather died	 I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.
label: sadness

text: [ The same as in anger.]
label: disgust

text: As a child when I was blamed for peeing in the swimming-pool.
label: shame

text:
A friend of mine was drunk and having an argument on the street á
with a woman	 appparently his girlfriend.  I was walking on the á
other side of the street and thought that I was not supposed to á
interfere.  Later I heard that he had shot himself that evening.
label: guilt

text: My girlfriend sent me a letter with a shiny picture in it.
label: joy

text:
I was about to begin a journey in a car with an acquaintance of á
mine.
label: fear

text:
On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about the á
increasing threat of war with the USA.
label: anger

text: My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).
label: sadness

text: Watching a violent movie.
label: disgust

text: The morning after a wild party.
label: shame

text:
I "picked up" a girl and I thought that I had misused my á
position and authority over her as there did not seem to be any á
realistic possibility of continuing the relationship.
label: guilt

text:
When	 to my surprise	 I got to know about having got "very good" á
high school graduation marks.
label: joy

text:
My grandmother was about to die	 and it had the effect that at á
night	 after having read a book	 and once in bed	 in perfect á
darkness	 the fear arose that I too may suddenly die.
label: fear

text:
When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been á
careless	 thoughtless	 lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary á
mistakes concerning things I know and understand.
label: anger

text:
When we decided	 my boyfriend and I	 that we would separate	 I á
realized that he would have wanted to continue our relationship á
and the coming separation hurt him.
label: sadness

text:
When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents á
treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of á
them got continuous encouragement	 and the youngest was not á
encouraged and was rejected.
label: disgust

text:
I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents and á
education.  I said something and then realized that I did not á
know my friend's parents	 their motives and education.  I felt á
ashamed at having talked about something I did not know anything á
about.
label: shame

text:
My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (I á
had torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-day á
enveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.
label: guilt

text:
I am not especially good at English	 and after the high school á
graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the á
whole day.  In the evening	 when I heard that I had done á
excellently	 I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.  My á
family was at home.
label: joy

text:
I feared that I was pregnant.  It was not planned and I would á
have been compelled to have an abortion	 which I would not have á
liked at all.  Fortunately	 after a week's anxiety	 I got to know á
that I was not pregnant.
label: fear

text:
A member of a religious sect tried to convert me	 using really á
evil tricks to persuade me.  After he had left	 I was anxious and á
angry for a long time. After the event	 I was alone.
label: anger

text: When my boyfriend wanted to leave me	 I felt sad and melancholic.
label: sadness

text:
In a film	 there was an episode where they used a chain saw to á
cut a man.  I could not look at it	 but I could not avoid á
listening either.  I sought shelter in my boyfriend's arms.
label: disgust

text:
I thought I would be able to use the mangle of the house	 and so á
I did not want any help.  However	 I blocked it and I had to get á
the janitor to help me out.  He reproached me for not having á
followed the instructions
label: shame

text:
I promised my friends that I would take care of something	 but I á
kept forgetting about it.  When they asked me about it	 I á
promised to do it immediately.  However	 I got started only after á
a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.
label: guilt

text:
When I got an unexpected letter from  a guy	 who had been my school á
mate.
label: joy

text:
When my brother went to shoot wild ducks	 I feared that the á
boat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun would á
accidentally go off.
label: fear

text:
My father had once again told me that I should be careful and try to á
seek admission to other places also apart from the faculty of á
Social Sciences at the university of Helsinki.  I was not at all á
interested in any other place and had no time to study for other á
entrance exams.
label: anger

text:
I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances	 but á
I realized that I was not wanted.  I felt hurt	 disappointed	 á
lonely and deserted.
label: sadness

text:
When an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen á
carpet.  It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in	 á
this acquaintance had helped her move in.á
label: disgust

text:
I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and I á
tended to boast a little	 till I realized that the listener was á
amused.
label: shame

text:
When I was baby-sitting at my cousin's place	 I tried to have a á
pleasant time and did not really take care of the child.  I do á
not care very much about children.
label: guilt

text:
When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was á
unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not á
surpass my abilities	 as I have sometimes thought.
label: joy

text:
When a big angry dog put its snout on my arm and had I made one á
movement it would have bitten me.
label: fear

text:
When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me á
from watching the news.  The first feeling I had was that I was á
being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.
label: anger

text:
[ When after a night of sleeping in another's arms	 one wakes á
alone and knows that the lonely arms of the night are not the á
same that one meets in the morning.]
label: sadness

text:
When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.  A á
subtle	 small	 insignificant	 grey being whose helplessness and á
neutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.
label: disgust

text:
Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feel á
ashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wanted á
to say.  Thoughtlessness.
label: shame

text:
When I behaved improperly - fought in a public place.  á
Afterwards	 I felt guilty about my conduct.
label: guilt

text:
When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a á
moment.
label: joy

text:
My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed á
at night.
label: fear

text:
My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell á
me if they were visiting me or not.
label: anger

text: A close friend of mine had not contacted me for a long time.
label: sadness

text: A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.
label: disgust

text: I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.
label: shame

text:
I did not go to help a friend of mine	 though she probably needed á
me.
label: guilt

text:
When I felt that an exam	 which I had feared	 was an easy one and á
went well.
label: joy

text:
I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fence á
when  a train was coming.
label: fear

text:
When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the á
stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his á
friends. They could not think about anything sensible	 but would á
fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of á
other persons.á
label: anger

text:
I felt sad after having had an argument with my boyfriend.  I felt á
that he did not understand me and that there was no point in á
carrying on with the relationship.
label: sadness

text:
I detested my father who was a drunkard.  He would rave	 á
threaten and blame my mother and me.  He finally drove us away á
from home.
label: disgust

text:
When I was on holiday with my former boyfriend	 he hit me and á
behaved in a very evil and ugly manner in front of the hotel á
personnel.
label: shame

text:
When as a child I stole	 from a friend of mine	 the ring she had á
got in an easter egg.
label: guilt

text:
When I got home from a pleasant trip abroad	 I got to know that I á
had been accepted at university.
label: joy

text:
At school	 I had acted against the will of the group	 and the á
next day they promised to take revenge on me.
label: fear

text:
My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a á
good friend who	 she thought	 was not good company for me.  á
Finally	 at breakfast one day	 we had an argument and I tried to á
defend my friend.
label: anger

text: I got to know about the death of a close friend.
label: sadness

text:
When I was watching a movie with many violent episodes.  They á
accurately showed the cutting of corpses	 etc...
label: disgust

text:
When I was caught telling a white lie.  At that time	 I was not á
allowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.  One day when I was late	 I á
made up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place	 á
though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing with á
my pals.
label: shame

text:
When before the last exam I have taken	 I went out instead of á
studying.
label: guilt

text:
When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought á
the cloth after months of hindrances.
label: joy

text:
I am a kindergarten teacher and I am thoroughly weary of my job.  á
After having taken the university entrance exam I suffered from á
anxiety for weeks as I did not want to carry on with my work - studies á
were the only alternative.
label: fear

text:
My life-partner	 who was drinking more and more	 spoke about á
kicking the cat.  He had never done anything of the kind	 but I á
knew that he would do so one day	 without thinking about it.
label: anger

text:
Estrangement from my best woman friend.  We have been going á
different ways for quite some time now	 but the break was total á
when she got married as her husband is unreasonably jealous of me.
label: sadness

text:
My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life	 old-fashioned values) á
and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions.  I have á
noticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems by á
drinking.  I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.
label: disgust

text:
Again	 a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My á
life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it á
disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.
label: shame

text:
A lonely	 neurotic	 shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed a á
wish to meet me	 I have however avoided her (turned down an á
invitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up all á
my empathy.
label: guilt

text:
Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness	 beer and á
wine.
label: joy

text:
The fear about my future : work	 making ends meet and health. á
Coping.
label: fear

text:
A friend of mine ridiculed me	 telling me that I would never á
accomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.
label: anger

text:
I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problems á
and failed attempts at reconciliation.  My sadness was caused by á
the irreversibility of the decision.
label: sadness

text: A man spat on the wall of a house.
label: disgust

text:
In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens and á
invalids.
label: shame

text:
When I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished a á
nonacademic degree.
label: guilt

text:
When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry	 I understood á
something about why I exist and what my task in life is.
label: joy

text:
At the railway station	 while waiting for the last train at night á
I noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in a á
purposeful mannner.
label: fear

text:
While having a discussion with my mother	 I realized that she á
does not for a moment doubt the justification of her making the á
decisions concerning my life.
label: anger

text:
When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact á
with my parents.
label: sadness

text:
While reading Olli Jalonen's new book	 the distant	 cold and á
selfish relationships between people (in the book) made me feel á
disgusted.
label: disgust

text: When I approached a person of the opposite sex and was rejected.
label: shame

text:
When I noticed that my little sister was sulking	 because I could á
not meet her because of a misunderstanding.
label: guilt

text:
The day I got to know that I would get a shared dwelling with my á
boyfriend.  My parents place was getting a little crowded with á
my growing bother wanting a room to himself.  I first felt doubt	 á
then joy	 but also sadness.  The feeling of joy was the á
strongest.
label: joy

text:
My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at á
home.  I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost choked á
on mucus secretions.
label: fear

text:
The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those close á
to me.(blaming us and lying)
label: anger

text: We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.
label: sadness

text: A very drunk person.
label: disgust

text:
An argument that grew out of an ordinary conversation with a á
person very close to me	 when we should have been having a good á
time together.

 I sold my friend	 I was despicable.

label: sadness

text:
When I was still a child	 I saw a horror film on TV in which á
there was a rotten human skull.
label: disgust

text:
As a small boy	 I took a coin from an empty taxi cab.  My mother á
saw it and told the driver about it.  I even knew the driver.
label: shame

text: When I betrayed my former girlfriend.
label: guilt

text:
New Year's Eve party in the country	 I hardly knew a person; my á
partner spent most of the time at the bar. I had little á
opportunity to get to know people because our table was separated á
and my boyfriend's parents were present.
label: anger

text:
Christmas Eve: there was a tension between my parents	 they did á
not even try to restore a harmonic atmosphere. Mother stayed in á
her room almost the whole day. I felt alone and was very sad.
label: sadness

text:
Father said: If you are pregnant	 you will have to procure á
abortion. I was filled with disgust against my father.
label: disgust

text:
I had an intimate relation with my boyfriend	 but unfortunately á
we had sexual problems; therefore I deceived him	 but I was á
ashamed when I told my friend about it.
label: shame

text:
I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day á
in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold á
for half an hour.
label: guilt

text:
After one year of searching	 my friend and I have found a flat we á
are able to pay for.
label: joy

text: Car accident in the middle of the night.
label: fear

text:
At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of a á
sports event	 but my teacher refused to give me the day off á
because he didn't like me.
label: anger

text: When I was six years old	 my favourite cat died.
label: sadness

text:
A gigantic spider climbed over my face and what is more - in my á
own flat.
label: disgust

text:
I was very fat and felt absolutely unwell. I was afraid of á
leaving the house and getting to know new people.
label: shame

text:
I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and á
growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until á
several weeks later.
label: guilt

text:
I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informed á
about it	 I felt joy.
label: joy

text:
My sister had to undergo a very complicated operation	 her á
eyesight was at stake.
label: fear

text: I had a quarrel with my parents; I was convinced to be right.
label: anger

text:
I heard that a friend had died in an accident; group situation: á
suddenly a friend came in and said "Have you already heard á
that..."; there was a terrible consternation	 silence	 then á
everybody shouted excitedly "How could that happen...".
label: sadness

text:
Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna	 three drunk á
men thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene from á
another carriage.
label: disgust

text:
I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretended á
love and affection to be able to sleep with her.
label: shame

text:
A young girl tried to put an end to her life because of lover's á
grief; not until she was in hospital I heard that I had been the á
reason for her action.
label: guilt

text:
In order to be admitted to my final examination	 I had to pass á
two examinations. As I had not studied very much	 I resigned á
myself to be left behind. Nevertheless I succeeded in these á
examinations.
label: joy

text:
I had not told my parents about my bad marks in school. One day	 á
my father wanted to speak to the teachers. Fortunately I could á
influence my parents to take it easy.
label: fear

text:
I wanted to go to a friend of mine who had a party; at the moment á
I wanted to leave	 my father said I couldn't go because he needed á
me for some work in the afternoon.
label: anger

text:
A friend of mine	 who had repeated a year at school once before	 á
did not pass the final examination and had to take it again half á
a year later.
label: sadness

text:
Eco-activists demonstrated against a project to build a power station á
at the Danube in the middle of a lowland forest (Hainburg) and á
the government decided to delay it for another year. When my á
father heard about it	 he said that we needed another Hitler.
label: disgust

text:
There was a time when my room looked terribly untidy; just at á
that time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent her á
from entering the room.
label: shame

text:
I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop	 but I did á
not do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraid á
that he would grumble.
label: guilt

text: My boyfriend returned after a long absence.
label: joy

text: My car skidded on the wet street.
label: fear

text:
I wanted to see a friend	 I had been looking forward to it and á
had certain expectations	 but he did not pay any attention to me	 á
played cards with other people.
label: anger

text:
A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strange á
manner.
label: sadness

text:
In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playing á
with his penis in the middle of the town.
label: disgust

text:
Somebody who knows me very well discovered that I had told him a á
lie.
label: shame

text:
When my boyfriend was away	 I flirted with his best friend; I á
felt guilty the next day.
label: guilt

text:
Recently a good friend only called me when he needed something. á
He never said "please" or "thank you" or any other kind word.
label: anger

text:
My favourite horse died. We had tried our best to save him	 but á
it was hopeless	 he had to be shot.
label: sadness

text:
I read a book about the sexual phantasies of women; I read about á
a woman having sexual intercourse with a dog.
label: disgust

text:
In our flat the bath-tub is in the kitchen. At the beginning I á
had very intensive feelings of shame when I had a bath and people á
were in the kitchen.
label: shame

text:
I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for several á
weeks. I watered them	 but let them stand in a cold room so that á
two of them perished.
label: guilt

text:
When I met a good friend after a long time. We had had a quarrel á
but after two weeks I was really glad to see him again.
label: joy

text:
When we stayed in Vienna with our class	 my friend and I behaved á
incorrectly. Our teacher threatened us with exclusion from á
school.
label: fear

text:
When I lost my driving license because I had been driving while á
under the influence of alcool.
label: anger

text: My mother's death.
label: sadness

text:
When I entered the dissecting room for the first time. I think I á
felt disgusted mainly because of the bad smell of formaline.
label: disgust

text:
I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a night á
club.
label: shame

text:
During a ski tour with a friend	 we two had drunk too much. When á
we went down the slope on ski	 I lost my friend who had lost his á
way. I thought that something must have happened to him (he á
finally arrived but after a very long time).
label: guilt

text:
My father stayed abroad for one year. He does not like to write á
letters because he makes ortographic mistakes. I never had a good á
relation to him. He wrote me a letter in which he said that he á
loved me.
label: joy

text:
When I was a child	 I was always afraid of my father. Just when á
he looked at me	 I felt frightened.
label: fear

text:
A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explain á
things as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in an á
aggressive manner.
label: anger

text:
During the Christmas holidays	 I went to see my parents and á
stayed with them for two weeks. After two or three days	 we had á
the same conflicts we had had ten years before when I had lived á
with them. They were glad when I left.
label: sadness

text:
Old man in hospital	 hollow-cheeked	 only one half of his nose á
and glass-eye	 rattling breath.
label: disgust

text:
When my father came into the bathroom and saw me standing there á
naked.
label: shame

text:
I live with my boyfriend	 we have a close relationship	 I fell in á
love with another man.
label: guilt

text: When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.
label: joy

text:
One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car	 á
but I was too frightened to go and see.
label: fear

text:
When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in a á
chair.
label: anger

text: A person died (not really a friend).
label: sadness

text:
Several weeks ago	 I had problems with friends	 I felt disgusted á
by a friend.
label: disgust

text:
When I was a child	 I thought that I had to be ashamed when á
asking and doing certain forbidden things.
label: shame

text: When quarreling with friends.
label: guilt

text:
In Southern Tyrol	 I was gathering apples	 it was a fine day	 I á
was not thinking about anything	 I felt an overwhelming joy.
label: joy

text:
My girlfriend and I slept in a lonely hut (we had drunk alcool). á
Suddenly some soil fell on us	 then some water. Although we tried á
hard	 we could not find out the cause.
label: fear

text:
I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics. á
Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained and á
started to cry. I grew angry.
label: anger

text: When my girlfriend told me that she wanted to leave me.
label: sadness

text:
On a trip I passed by a cellulose factory. It was a fine day	 á
beautiful landscape; I observed this factory with disgust.
label: disgust

text:
When I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was á
16). When I entered the sauna naked	 I felt ashamed for a short á
time.
label: shame

text:
I came home from a discotheque at half past four in the morning	 á
although I had promised my parents to come home at midnight. From á
3 a.m. I felt guilty towards my parents.
label: guilt

text: A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.
label: joy

text:
On my way through lonely streets I met with a huge stray dog. It á
stopped at some distance and looked at me. I tried to ignore it á
but I was very frightened.
label: fear

text:
A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to act á
as a model because she felt too tired. It was a quarter of an á
hour before the appointed time	 I had just lied down and did not á
want to go because it was too late anyway. She said that I only á
was talking about looking for work	 but if it was possible I á
would not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.
label: anger

text:
After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for half á
a year	 I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (for á
economic reasons). We separated although I loved him.
label: sadness

text:
In a certain book I read about cruelties and violence in prison á
and souteneur circles; I felt especially disgusted when I read á
detailed descriptions of physical and mental torture of less á
powerful people.
label: disgust

text:
When I talked to a psychotherapist for the first time	 I started á
to cry; first I talked to him but he did not say anything and á
after a while I was crying.
label: shame

text:
I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother á
always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting á
my sister in defending herself against mother's interference	 I á
just behaved aggressively towards my sister.
label: guilt

text:
When I worked as an "au-pair-girl" in London	 I received a call á
from a good friend who told me that she was in London too and á
wanted to see me. I was very glad - after that call and á
especially when I saw her.
label: joy

text:
It was on St. Claus Day when I was five years old. St. Claus and á
his Devil Servant came to see me. St. Claus' Devil Servant á
rattled with his chain and bowled terribly. I was so frightened á
that my parents had to ask him to leave.
label: fear

text:
A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and see á
me. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town. á
Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I got á
impatient I called her but her parents told me that she had gone á
skiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointment á
to be able to see her.
label: anger

text:
When I was eight years old my father was run over by a car. When á
I saw his body I was sad beyond words.
label: sadness

text:
A friend prepared a soup with chicken heads and invited me to eat á
it. I saw the eyes staring at me and the tongues hanging out of á
the bills. I was so disgusted that I felt nausea and had to leave á
the room.
label: disgust

text:
When I had to go to the gynecologist and to sit on that special á
chair	 I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text:
After a terrible quarrel with my family	 I withdrew in my room. I á
felt guilty because I had caused this scene by my aggressive á
behavior.
label: guilt

text:
I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very á
much.
label: joy

text:
I was afraid of a certain examination although I was relatively á
well prepared.
label: fear

text:
At the hairdresser's	 I got two stains of dyestuff on my new á
trousers. These stains are not removable	 so I cannot put on the á
trousers again.
label: anger

text:
In 1977	 my grandfather	 to whom I had a very close relationship	 á
died.
label: sadness

text: A drunken man forced me to kiss him.
label: disgust

text:
A friend started to insult another person without reason and I á
felt ashamed of her behavior.
label: shame

text:
I had to call somebody between 12 and 12:30. As I had no á
possibility to call him at this time	 I did not do it until 3 á
p.m.
label: guilt

text:
After a one year's stay abroad	 I returned home. I was even more á
glad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.
label: joy

text:
I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark	 I went very á
fast. Behind me	 there were some drunk men who shouted at me. By á
chance	 I met some friends who accompanied me.
label: fear

text:
A friend who shares the room with me	 opened the window in the á
morning and left the room the whole day. When I came home in the á
evening	 the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.
label: anger

text:
When my aunt	 whom I had loved very much	 died. When I heard á
about her death	 I was not as touched as at the funeral. I really á
became conscious of her death at that moment.
label: sadness

text:
A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many á
people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said á
and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear. á
He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted á
when he told that.
label: disgust

text:
In a restaurant	 I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told á
the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him á
that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard á
that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.
label: shame

text:
After closing the front door I realized that I had left the key á
inside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my own á
house but the house of people I hardly knew.
label: guilt

text:
On our way to France	 my girlfriend and I went to Verona. By á
chance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets for á
the dress-rehearsal of "Aida". It was a different world for us á
full of fascination. After the representation we ate a phantastic á
pizza in a restaurant near the "Arena".
label: joy

text:
On a mountain tour	 my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near á
the house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As my á
girlfriend is afraid of dogs	 I had to draw his attention to me. á
He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I á
really did not like that.
label: fear

text:
I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some á
silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry  á
clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.
label: anger

text:
I had to leave my girlfriend for 4 weeks because of my studies. á
This happens frequently. The last 24 hours before my departure á
are always very depressing.
label: sadness

text:
When I stayed in the house of friends	 I washed my face and á
wanted to dry it with a towel. This towel seemed to have been á
used over a long time already. It smelled indefinably awful.
label: disgust

text:
A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore	 once I á
stayed with him and his girlfriend	 I bought some meat	 but nobody á
wanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said "I thought á
you wanted to invite us for dinner". "Of course"	 I said	 but I á
thought by myself that it must have been enough that I had bought á
it.
label: shame

text:
It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girl á
but I considered it only as an "affair". Only much later I realized á
how painful this must have been for the girl.
label: guilt

text:
When I was informed that a short story I had written had been á
accepted for publication.
label: joy

text:
Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friends á
was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming á
in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and á
prevent the accident.
label: fear

text:
I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had á
caused. A third person meddled in our conversation	 turned my á
efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had á
intended.
label: anger

text: Death of my grandmother.
label: sadness

text:
In school I had difficulties mith mathematics. When I had to work á
for an examination	 I really felt disgusted.
label: disgust

text:
I played in a stage play. Suddenly	 in front of 200 people	 I á
could not remember the words I had to say.
label: shame

text:
One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I á
did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had á
a bad conscience and felt guilty.
label: guilt

text: After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.
label: joy

text:
One evening	 in the tramway	 I was afraid of two drunk men á
molesting my girlfriend and me.
label: fear

text:
I went singing with a group of young people on January 6th (The á
three Magi)	 a local custom called "star singing". One of the girls	 my á
girlfriend	 broke the star. Being the accompanying person	 I felt very á
angry thinking of the consequences.
label: anger

text:
When the grandmother of my friend died in a hospital. My friend á
was crying and I was sad	 too.
label: sadness

text:
I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out of á
his mouth while speaking.
label: disgust

text:
It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something	 
but I felt that I was not able to express myself very well - I felt á
ashamed and blushed.
label: shame

text:
My girlfriend's results in school had become worse because I á
prevented her from learning (we often went out etc.).
label: guilt

text:
I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything for á
me	 I was very glad.
label: joy

text:
When I was a child	 I heard the floor cracking and I thought á
there was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket and á
trembled.
label: fear

text:
During a lecture	 a colleague who did not know anything about the á
subject	 got on my nerves asking silly questions.
label: anger

text:
When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would miss á
them.
label: sadness

text:
During a football game	 another player who was perspiring very á
strongly ran into me.
label: disgust

text:
I tried to pass an examination particularly well	 but I did it á
worse than ever. I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text:
During the military service	 I lost a part of an equipment; I á
accused another person and he was rebuked and punished.
label: guilt

text:
At a choral concert I appeared as a solist. The concert5 was very á
good	 I forgot all the hard work that had been done before. There á
remained only an undescribable joy and a feeling of warmth	 á
security etc.
label: joy

text:
I am a "cantor" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago I á
had to sing too	 but the organist did not tell me in time. As I á
did not know the psalm	 I was afraid and said that I could not á
sing.
label: fear

text:
During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother	 his á
girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my á
brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place á
for dinner	 she refused and never mentioned it again as if I á
had never asked her.
label: anger

text:
Several years ago my brother died in an accident. When I heard á
about it	 I was very sad. It took years until I resigned myself á
to it.
label: sadness

text:
I read a book about the situation in South-Africa	 about the á
terrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with the á
white population.
label: disgust

text:
My P.T. instructor also works as a masseur. He wanted to massage á
me	 therefore I had to undress. For the first few times this was á
not easy for me; I got gradually used to it.
label: shame

text:
Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the á
theoretical questions very well	 but I failed the practical á
driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.
label: guilt

text:
When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He had á
undergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death. á
When he came home I could see him smile for the first time after á
may weeks.
label: joy

text:
After a short stay in Marocco we missed the ferry-boat back to á
Spain and we had to look for an accomodation. By chance we met a á
man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his á
car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being á
robbed in Marocco.
label: fear

text:
After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to á
relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had á
finished after an hour	 there was no hot water left for me.
label: anger

text:
I met some nice people during my holdidays. When they left I knew á
that I would never see them again.
label: sadness

text:
A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by á
insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in á
front of her child. She left it happen without saying a word in á
order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to á
calm the man	 but without success. Just because he was stronger á
we had to comply. From that day I detested him.
label: disgust

text:
For a medical check-up	 we - boys and girls - had to take off our á
clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go á
into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and á
staring at us.
label: shame

text:
I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way. á
My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water	 slapped á
my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.
label: guilt

text:
One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to á
somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.
label: joy

text:
I was driving my car and it was very misty. It was in the night á
and I was alone in my car. I felt totally insecure	 nervous and á
overstrained.
label: fear

text:
My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I said á
mean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.
label: anger

text:
When my uncle died whom I had loved very much. I was very sad and á
I felt totally helpless.
label: sadness

text:
I watched the news at the TV	 it was a commentary about á
"Hainburg". I felt disgusted when I heard members of the union á
speak about the situation.
label: disgust

text:
I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me á
when I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.
label: shame

text:
I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend	 I said things which á
I could have said in a more friendly way. After that I felt á
guilty.
label: guilt

text:
A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Once á
she had a child she had a better relationship with them.
label: joy

text:
Once our school class went skiing. On a steep slope a boy á
standing behind me lost his balance	 fell down and drew me with á
him. I slided down the whole slope. At about 1 m distance from a á
tree I could stop.
label: fear

text:
It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble about á
the young people just because I had not immediately left my seat á
to them.
label: anger

text:
When I was younger I was very good in apparatus gymnastics. I á
always won in competitions	 but once I was only at the fourth á
place.
label: sadness

text: A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.
label: disgust

text: Some men were talking about me and my sister.
label: shame

text:
During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me á
outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain á
hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the á
circumstances
label: guilt

text:
I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I had á
not seen for two years.
label: joy

text:
I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house. á
I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and there á
was a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.
label: fear

text:
At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me á
and nobody mentioned anything about that.
label: anger

text:
My little cat which I had raised all by myself	 hanged itself when á
playing in the garden.
label: sadness

text:
At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to help á
another boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose the á
wrong things so that he had to repeat a year.
label: disgust

text:
When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her á
feel hurt.
label: shame

text:
I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment á
but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed á
holiday job.
label: guilt

text:
I have a boyfriend and I am very fond of him. When we had our á
"11-months jubilee"	 I had forgotten it. But he gave me a red á
rose.
label: joy

text:
When I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day when I came á
home a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was so á
frightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waited á
until somebody passed by.
label: fear

text:
I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could á
not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the á
University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it á
finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home á
she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her á
boyfriend.
label: anger

text:
When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His á
legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I á
came into the room	 did not notice him and stepped on him. A few á
days later he died.
label: sadness

text:
When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had á
big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of á
the night and shouted at me.
label: disgust

text:
At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher had á
admonished me to do my homework	 one day I had forgotten to do á
it. When my teacher noticed it	 I blushed and was ashamed to be á
rebuked in front of the other pupils.á
label: shame

text:
When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister. á
Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried á
and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.
label: guilt

text:
After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurried á
home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feeling á
his body.
