label: anger

text:
I was at home alone when I realized that a young roe approached á
our house. I hid because I did not want to frighten it. It á
limped. Some time later	 when I thought that it had already run á
away	 I saw it lying on our terrace. I came nearer and saw that á
it was terribly wounded. I informed the ranger who said that the á
roe must have been attacked by dogs. He had to shoot it.
label: sadness

text:
Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for one á
week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my á
friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was á
terrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had an á
improper and unsavoury conversation.
label: disgust

text:
My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my á
grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory á
comments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had á
died recently.
label: shame

text:
When I still went to primary-school	 I went on a ski-trip with my á
family. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly á
my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He á
gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties á
with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help á
me. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second á
key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.
label: guilt

text:
I had not studied very much for my final examination at school	 á
so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral á
examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I á
heard that I had passed it.
label: joy

text:
When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is á
not a complicated operation	 but just before it started I was á
very afraid so that I will never forget it.
label: fear

text:
My parents are divorced	 father pays alimony for me. Two years á
ago my sister who lives with father	 suddenly asked mother for á
money. As she considered the amount of money my mother offered á
her too small	 she brought an action against mother. I was á
terribly angry with my sister.
label: anger

text:
I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me á
to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come á
home late in the morning. Next day I called him - he was not at á
home. As something like that had happened to me several times á
before	 I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody á
and I felt very sad.
label: sadness

text: Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.
label: disgust

text:
When I had slept with a boy for the first time I felt ashamed for á
three reasons. First	 because I was only 13 years old	 second	 á
because I did not really like him	 third	 because he had caught á
me napping.
label: shame

text:
I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years	 á
when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal á
that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a á
bit guilty for what had happened.
label: guilt

text:
My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of á
the life-saving dogs.
label: joy

text:
I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thought á
that it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the red á
switch.
label: fear

text:
A man treated his dog very badly - he insulted and beated him á
until the dog kept lying on the floor with his tail drawn in.
label: anger

text: A horse which I had liked very much was taken away.
label: sadness

text:
On TV I saw a report about church in Amerika. A priest was shown á
who was performing miracles in front of the camera - I felt á
disgusted.
label: disgust

text:
When I was a child	 my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and á
ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after á
me and insisted on my apologizing.
label: shame

text:
I quarreled with my boy-friend. He said it was unfair that I á
always started crying so that he had to give in.
label: guilt

text:
To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination	 á
I did not spend the nitht with my girl-friend but in the á
students' hostel. I had not done that for months. The day when I á
had the examn	 somebody knocked at my door at seven o'clock in á
the morning. My girl-friend who likes sleeping late	 had come to á
be able to be with me.
label: joy

text:
I studied medicine for several semesters and at that time I á
developed a great fear of examinations. I was most afraid of my á
examination of anatomy. While other students were examined	 I was á
dissecting. I was able to hear everything and was waiting with á
fear until it was my turn.
label: fear

text:
When I come home in the evening	 the first thing I do is to sit á
down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally á
desolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had not á
finished.
label: anger

text:
My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and á
take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for á
me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own á
feelings were intensified.
label: sadness

text:
When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed á
only helplessness and indecision.
label: disgust

text:
I spent an evening with my girl-friend. When we wanted to go to á
bed I was totally drunk. Next morning I felt rather ashamed.
label: shame

text:
I threw away an object	 which belonged to a friend	 because I did á
not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that á
and I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text: After a long time I saw my boy-friend again.
label: joy

text: My first public appearance in front of a rathe big audience.
label: fear

text:
I was angry about how the government acted concerning Hainburg	 á
especially when I saw a discussion about it on TV.
label: anger

text: Death of my father; he died of laryngeal cancer.
label: sadness

text: When I got indecent offers.
label: disgust

text:
When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that á
I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.
label: shame

text:
My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend á
himself very well; I should have taken his part.
label: guilt

text:
I thought that I had failed an examination	 but when I was á
informed about the mark	 I saw that I had passed it.
label: joy

text:
Before an examination: I had the fealing that I had not learned á
enough.
label: fear

text:
Once when I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I á
would win 	 but at last I lost the game.
label: anger

text: My grandfather's funeral.
label: sadness

text:
In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out his á
guts when he was still alive.
label: disgust

text:
I was sitting in a restaurant with friends. They asked me á
something which they thought I should know. Actually I know it	 á
but at that time I was not able to remember it.
label: shame

text:
I had an appointment with a friend. I promised him to meet with á
him	 but at last I did not without having informed him.
label: guilt

text:
When I had a psychical crisis	 I met a girl	 who told me that she á
had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome á
them.
label: joy

text:
I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick á
caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars á
and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on á
my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.
label: fear

text:
A friend of mine told other people that I was a slattern (because á
of an occurence that had happened some time ago). When I heard á
about that I was very angry.
label: anger

text:
My grandfather was seriously ill	 he had only a few days left to á
live. I had always loved him	 but never told him. When I saw him á
for the last time	 I had the feeling that I had omitted so many á
things I could not do again. - There was a fly sitting on his á
forehead and he was too weak to drive it away. I was very sad á
when I saw that.
label: sadness

text:
Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes	 we do not speak á
about sexual things	 too. But once he told such a vulgar joke	 á
that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me	 but some of his á
friends	 but I was present.
label: disgust

text:
When I was 6 or 7 years old	 I pulled down the trousers of a á
friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother á
watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We á
never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as á
it was for me.
label: shame

text:
When I told my boy-friend	 who loved me very much	 that I wanted á
to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him á
that and also a long time after that I felt guilty	 because I had á
hurt him so much.
label: guilt

text:
Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much. á
Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their á
group	 although it was late in the evening.
label: joy

text:
After a footballmatch I went home by car	 a friend drove. I did á
not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was á
madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I á
told him to be cautious	 but he did not care.
label: fear

text:
A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. I á
am always angry about that	 because it is an unnecessary luxury. á
Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again. á
When I had already put the oil into the pan	 he poured it out á
again and put the butter into the pan.
label: anger

text:
After some friends had come to see me. They had stayed for á
several days and we had got on very well. When they had left	 I á
had a feeling of emptyness.
label: sadness

text:
I had a quarrel with a friend who lived with me in the same flat. á
He moved out. Before he went he invited me and some friends for a á
drink. At last he was totally drunk and smelled disgusting. á
Besides	 he told lies about us and behaved as if he was to be á
pitied.
label: disgust

text:
I went to see a friend. There were other people	 too	 and á
everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought á
nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything á
- although I knew how he felt.
label: shame

text:
With a group of handicapped people we went to a party. When we á
wanted to leave we were not able to find one of these people. I á
had told his mother that we would leave at 4.30 p.m.	 actually it á
was planned for 3.30 p.m. Therefore there was a delay.
label: guilt

text:
I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault	 á
everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he á
surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.
label: joy

text:
After my boy-friend had beaten me for the first time	 I always á
trembled when somebody knocked on my door or when I heard steps á
coming nearer.
label: fear

text:
I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine á
for my fiancT. But he stayed in another town and spent one á
thousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.
label: anger

text: I had to give up my love	 because it did not work out well.
label: sadness

text: I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.
label: disgust

text:
My boyfriend had drunk too much and beaten me. When I had to show á
the letter the door	 which was almost crashed	 I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text:
I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw that á
there was no reason for that.
label: guilt

text:
My sister had a daughter. I saw the baby for the first time á
through a pane of glass and she looked at me.
label: joy

text:
My mother	 my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and á
watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to á
turn off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and á
started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid á
that he would do us a harm.
label: fear

text:
I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watching á
the fish when my father came in and asked me how much I had payed á
for it. He said he would not pay for the current that it would á
require.
label: anger

text:
When I was 9 years old	 I got a cat	 but after 3 days he died. I á
was very sad	 because I had nursed him and taken him to the á
veterinary's - but in vain. Although I had had him only for a á
short time I had liked him very much.
label: sadness

text:
When my grandmother was about 80 years old	 she lived with us for á
several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breath á
the air that smelled of her presence.
label: disgust

text:
I am left-handed. When I attended the first form	 we learned to á
write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my á
friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was á
looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.
label: shame

text:
When I was 4	 we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and á
her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wanted á
to arrive before them and went on a shorter	 but more dangerous á
way. When I arrived	 I found nobody there. I waited for a long á
time	 but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had á
been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me	 but I saw á
how much she had worried (herself).
label: guilt

text:
When I was 17	 I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzling á
light	 which omitted perfect love. The physical experience became á
unimportant	 I heard or saw the words "overcome egotism". The á
feeling of joy remained for month after that experience.
label: joy

text:
When we had swimming instruction	 we had to take a header from á
the springboard. I usually refused to do that	 but at least I was á
forced to.
label: fear

text:
When I played in a chess championship	 I was disturbed by other á
people. I asked them to be quiet	 but in vain.
label: anger

text: When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.
label: sadness

text:
When I was a child	 I was sometimes forced to eat things that á
disgusted me.
label: disgust

text:
When I was 12 years old	 some friends of our family had come to á
watch TV. I lay on the floor and moved my pelvis. When the other á
people had gone	 my mother told me that it had looked as if I had á
wanted to make sex.
label: shame

text:
When I shirked the gymnastic lesson I met the director of our á
school who asked me what I was doing.
label: guilt

text:
When I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me	 I moved á
back to my parents. For my father it went without saying anything á
(normally he ofter grumbles at me).
label: joy

text:
I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me	 á
that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually her husband could á
not stand that any more and wanted to kill me.
label: fear

text:
I have a very big family. At my grandmother's funeral we all met á
and everybody pretended mourning. In reality it was like a á
fashion-show: everybody wanted to show himself.
label: anger

text: Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.
label: sadness

text:
After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat	 one of them did á
not want to leave	 because he wanted to sleep with me. He said á
that he had fallen in love with me	 that he felt alone and so on.
label: disgust

text:
I look up to my Karate-teacher. When I came to a training lesson á
after I had not trained for one week	 I was totally stiff. I was á
ashamed.
label: shame

text:
My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km á
off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough á
room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there á
once again. When I did not do that they had a way to make me feel á
guilty.
label: guilt

text:
When I heard that I had passed my final examination at school á
(with success).
label: joy

text: Before my final examination.
label: fear

text: When my mother kept me in leading-strings.
label: anger

text: When my father died.
label: sadness

text: When I worked at the life-saving sevice and saw the first exitus.
label: disgust

text: When I made a fool at an examination.
label: shame

text:
When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an á
examination.
label: guilt

text:
Last year I went to see friends in Yugoslavia - two girls with á
whom I get along very well.
label: joy

text:
Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for several á
reasons: because it was for the first time	 because the medical á
check-up might be painful	 because of the uncertainty and because á
someone had informed me about it.
label: fear

text:
My girl-friend did not understand me; I was angry with myself á
because I had problems when we seperated - I could not resign á
myself to it.
label: anger

text: A friend who was 22 years old died.
label: sadness

text:
When I was in the army	 we got a certain dish for dinner that I á
do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat	 but I was very á
hungry.
label: disgust

text: I had to pay a fine because of speeding.
label: shame

text:
A friend who was 22 years old	 died of leukemia; I had not known á
that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.
label: guilt

text: When we got a young dog.
label: joy

text: I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.
label: fear

text: I had an accident with damage to the car body.
label: anger

text: My dog died of a cerebral tumor.
label: sadness

text:
When I worked at the life-saving service I was disgusted by a á
patient whose outward appearance was distasteful.
label: disgust

text:
When I was a child	 I had a medical check-up. I had to undress á
myself and was examined by several doctors.
label: shame

text:
When a classmate wanted to sit down	 I pulled his chair away	 so á
that he was slightly injured.
label: guilt

text:
When I heard that a good friend	 who had been abroad for a long á
time	 would come and see me.
label: joy

text:
When I had my first oral examination after a long time; á
especially one day before the examination when I had the feeling á
that I had not studied enough and had not enough time to make up á
for it.
label: fear

text:
I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room	 although á
they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.
label: anger

text: When my brother died.
label: sadness

text:
I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cutting á
open their stomaches and taking out their bowels.
label: disgust

text:
When I was a child: I had told my mother a lie and she found it á
out.
label: shame

text:
My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and á
sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and á
when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad á
about that.
label: guilt

text: I unexpectedly got a present from my father.
label: joy

text:
When I had to go through lonely streets in the middle of the á
night.
label: fear

text:
My boy-friend had promised me to come home at about 10 p.m. He á
did not return until midnight and had consumed a lot of alcohol.
label: anger

text: A relative	 whom I like very much	 left for the United States.
label: sadness

text:
When I was walking on the street	 I slipped on the dung of a dog. á
I did not fall down	 but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my á
sole.
label: disgust

text:
Some persons	 who are important for me	 came to see me and I had á
not washed the dishes.
label: shame

text:
I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down	 á
was slightly injured and cried vociferously.
label: guilt

text:
I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long á
time.
label: joy

text:
I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that á
country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.
label: fear

text:
A friend had promised to get me a book which was very important á
for my work	 but she forgot it.
label: anger

text:
My dog	 whom I had had for eleven years	 died. I watched his á
soporification.
label: sadness

text:
A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately I á
was able to break loose.
label: disgust

text:
When I stayed on a nudism beach	 a man was watching me in a á
disagreeable way. I had the feeling that he was examining my á
body.
label: shame

text:
I had a quarrel with my father. He was depressed	 because á
somebody had treated him injustly. As we had an argument	 it was á
impossible for me to help him.
label: guilt

text:
My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at á
the station.
label: joy

text:
After a motor accident (I was the frong-seat-passenger) I spit á
blood.
label: fear

text:
At an office an application that I had made was turned down á
because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.
label: anger

text: My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.
label: sadness

text:
I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her á
awfully.
label: disgust

text:
After an oral examination I shook the professor's hand	 but he á
had only stretched it out for my ball-point-pen.
label: shame

text: I spread abroad an intimate secret.
label: guilt

text:
I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I á
was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.
label: joy

text:
My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my á
girl-friend had fallen in love with another man	 I was afraid to á
lose her.
label: fear

text:
I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers á
dropped out.
label: anger

text:
During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit á
suicide. She had just left hospital	 her lips were trembling	 she á
looked miserable.
label: sadness

text:
On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a á
woman who were quarreling	 beating each other	 shouting and so á
on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other á
in such a degrading way.
label: disgust

text:
My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get á
along very well and usually we share everything. Once we two were á
sitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.
label: shame

text:
I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying á
in another room	 but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it á
would fall asleep. I went into the room where the baby was lying á
- and it started crying again.
label: guilt

text:
I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. When the train á
arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me	 I felt á
glad.
label: joy

text:
When I wanted to go into a house	 there was suddenly a big dog á
standing beside me. It was hardly moving	 but I did not know how á
it would react later on.
label: fear

text:
My father had bought too many goods for his shop	 there was not á
enough space to store them.
label: anger

text: A friend died of cancer when he was 18 years old.
label: sadness

text:
At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and á
the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression á
on me.
label: disgust

text:
During a discussion I said something rather stupid and á
unnecessary.
label: shame

text:
When I was driving my car	 I wanted to pick something from the á
floor of the car and drove into the guide-rail. I thought that I á
should not have done that and felt guilty.
label: guilt

text:
On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought á
me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.
label: joy

text:
I was awakened by a dream in the middle of the night. I dreamt á
that a stranger was in my house.
label: fear

text:
My boy-friend had promised me to come an 10 a.m. - he was 3 hours á
late.
label: anger

text: When I heard about a murder of a 16-year-old girl.
label: disgust

text:
When I broke the piggy bank of my brother and my mother á
discovered that.
label: shame

text:
I was sitting in a restaurant with friends and I knew that in the á
meantime my girl-friend must have come to my flat and found the á
door closed.
label: guilt

text:
After I had been away for a long time a friend told me that I had á
passed all my written examinations.
label: joy

text:
Recently my younger brother disappeared for two days without á
leaving a trace. Usually he tells me when he wants to do á
something like that	 therefore I was afraid that something had á
happened to him.
label: fear

text:
I played chess with my 12-year-old brother. I made a stupid á
mistake - and he won!
label: anger

text:
It was only once that I really felt sad: at my grandfather's á
funeral (after a long time of suffering he had died of cancer).
label: sadness

text:
3 years ago I served in the army. Once a collegue denounced me á
because of a delict	 which is usually committed. I was arrested á
for 3 days. I still detest this man.
label: disgust

text:
Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours from á
sleep.
label: shame

text:
When I was in the puberty I smashed the favourite toy of my á
little brother because of a fit of rage.
label: guilt

text:
After I had had a disappointment in my private life	 my friend	 á
who studies in Vienna	 came to see me spontaneously.
label: joy

text: Before an oral examination - which I did not take eventually.
label: fear

text:
A friend had promised me to give me a lift to Graz. To be sure I á
called her before we went. She told me that she had just promised á
another person to give him a lift.
label: anger

text: I am sad because some relations to friends are not very good.
label: sadness

text:
I think I have hardly had a situation where I felt disgusted. á
Perhaps once	 when I saw a big spider.
label: disgust

text: When my boy-friend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.
label: shame

text:
I promised my mother to come home on her birthday	 but at last I á
was prevented. Nevertheless it would have been possible to go but á
I did not.
label: guilt

text: Seeing relations from overseas after a few years.
label: joy

text:
Unknown person knocking repeatedly on backdoor when no one else á
was at home.
label: fear

text: Boyfriend "chatting up" another girl.
label: anger

text: A friend breaking up with her boyfriend.
label: sadness

text:
Accidentally seeing a friend in a compromising situation with a á
stranger.
label: disgust

text: Parents finding out I smoked.
label: shame

text: Not thanking relatives for a favor done.
label: guilt

text: Emotional reassurances by spouse.
label: joy

text: Movement in bush late at night while camping.
label: fear

text: Heated discussion with spouse concerning new house.
label: anger

text: Loss of close relative.
label: sadness

text: The price I was charged for work on my car.
label: disgust

text: Caused fault in V.C.R. by not following instructions carefully.
label: shame

text: Losing my temper with my spouse.
label: guilt

text: A night spent with a group of friends.
label: joy

text:
A car came very close to hitting me whilst I was crossing the á
street.
label: fear

text:
A friend whom I had gone out of my way to do something for did á
not bother to acknowledge my efforts	 and treated me badly á
thereafter.
label: anger

text:
A girlfriend ended our relationship in an abrupt and unexpected á
manner.
label: sadness

text:
A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 yearrs old) to my not á
responding in his favour to a request	 that is: he asked me for á
some money I refused	 and his reaction was quite childish.

I was taking place in an anti nuclear protest and was shouting á
protest loudly to some American sailors of the U.S. Texas á
submarine. A guy came up to me and said that's your brother á
screaming at	 I felt shame and I realized screaming at another á
person isn't good protesting. Now I'm a silent protester.
label: shame

text:
I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and having á
an argument. I was being stubborn and proud	 and selfish	 because á
my friend let me down	 through no fault of her own.
label: guilt

text:
When I met my boyfriend and we discovered that we shared the same á
ideals and goals in life	 and that we could share all our á
feelings and thoughts and felt that the world's not so bad when á
you have someone really close to share your life with.
label: joy

text:
I had called a boy who had dated me	 and told him that I was ill	 á
while	 actually	 I didn't want to go out with him	 later on	 he asked á
me if I was feeling better	 then I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text: When I hurt my parents in one way or another.
label: guilt

text: When I passed the driving test after three failures.
label: joy

text: When I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.
label: fear

text:
When playing a football match	 there was one player who made mean á
tackels	 kicked at everything and did things having nothing to do á
with football.
label: anger

text:
A close friend decided to stop with his study and to go back á
home.
label: sadness

text:
We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently used á
hard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friends á
also used them. While we agreed we would help the big user to á
stop using it.
label: disgust

text:
During a family reunion	 they started talking about me wearing an á
ear-ring.
label: shame

text:
It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy a á
present together. However	 now I had bought something together á
with my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.
label: guilt

text: For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.
label: joy

text:
Walking at friday night through Nijmegen	 going to a pub or a á
disco.
label: fear

text:
I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life á
of another by means of utterly unfair methods.
label: disgust

text:
I didn't do an important job and it had an adverse effect on á
other people.
label: shame

text: I stroke a person undeservedly.
label: guilt

text:
I sensed this feeling when I passed successfully the second tour á
of a competition.
label: joy

text: I felt fear when my mother was heavily ill.
label: fear

text:
I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal in á
acting. He hadn't learnt the text of an opera act in the course of á
several months and thus making difficulties for the rest of my á
colleagues.
label: anger

text:
I felt sadness when I had to get separated from the woman I loved á
who had to leave for her motherland.
label: sadness

text:
I felt disgust with the alcohol	 after I happened to see a young á
man	 who was dead to the world and who wallowed on the pavement. á
This "sight" I watched from the bus.
label: disgust

text:
I felt shame and I couldn't look into my teacher's eyes	 after á
not attending his lectures.
label: shame

text: I felt guilty after I battered to death a classmate of mine.
label: guilt

text:
I was happy when at difficult times I could find support in my á
friend and my fiancT	 I was happy because of their spiritual and á
moral help which gave me new power to struggle. I was happy then	 á
I felt it in my soul.
label: joy

text: I felt it at the same time when I felt disgust.
label: fear

text:
I felt it on the same occasion when I felt sadness which finally á
grew into anger.
label: anger

text:
My living and working conditions at home were unbearable. We used á
to live in a three room flat together with two more families. The á
discords caused a change - one of the families moved out. The á
other family stayed with us but I drifted away from my fiancT. In á
fact we were two families in the flat. Then I found myself alone á
in the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay next á
to me my grief and sorrow took on large proportions. I wanted to á
commit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause of á
the irritation.
label: sadness

text:
I am disgusted with my sister's husband. On an early Sunday á
morning after having knocked at my door	 he suddenly rushed in á
and finching me still in bed he began quarrelling about á
something. I could not understand. I heard his last words: "Don't á
stare at me so because I'll beat you in your bed" I got up á
terrified and a thrashing followed.
label: disgust

text:
I feel shame mixed with anger with the behavior of some á
incultivated people because my fiancT is a foreigner.
label: shame

text:
I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turned á
my sister out of my parents home.
label: guilt

text:
That was what I felt when I was finally accepted in the Bulgarian á
Conservatorie after I had applied a couple of years.
label: joy

text:
I experienced this feeling when the doctors found a nodule in one á
of my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusion á
resulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in my á
reason.
label: fear

text:
I had an accident with a trafic police car that was packed at a á
curve without any visibility and against all traffic regulations á
in a strong snowstorm. As a result I still cannot repair my car á
because of the missing spare parts.
label: anger

text:
A sudden doubt made me run for a long time in a rainy autumn á
night. When I reached the intended place I saw my beloved in á
another man's arms. A sudden blow	 grief	 I cannot qualify it	 it á
is painful for me to remember about it.
label: sadness

text:
I felt disgust with a man I had trusted and respected	 to whose á
problems I had always shown deep understanding.
label: disgust

text:
I was given the task to learn a page of music text for a small á
part. But I had forgotten all about it and I felt quite awkward á
when I had to show what I had prepared.
label: shame

text:
Some time ago I slapped my son without trying to understand who á
the real culprit of a damage was. After that I felt guilty and á
bad but it was too late.
label: guilt

text: My boyfriend made me a proposal.
label: joy

text:
I was to be given an audition to get a role. I had a competitress á
and I wasn't well prepared because I was ill.
label: fear

text:
A whole crowd of us went to a folklore festival. The instructor á
of the cast where my boyfriend played was traveling with us. We á
decided to catch the train that leaved early in the morning á
because we had business on the following day. The instructor á
tried to get the upper hand and made us catch the train in spite á
of everything	 all the time he made me angry.
label: anger

text: When I quarrelled with my boyfriend.
label: sadness

text:
I am disgusted with the fact that bad singers play at the opera á
(and not only there) only because they are protegTs or lovers of á
an important felow while at the same time some young and able á
singers work in a quite different field of life.
label: disgust

text:
I feel shy to show all my worth when I work for the first time á
with a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.
label: shame

text: I offended my mother.
label: guilt

text:
When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination and á
I realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.
label: joy

text:
Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no á
one to help me and call First Aid.
label: fear

text:
When I was admitted to a Language school. On the day when I was á
informed by a message and my parents congratulated me.
label: joy

text:
When diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I felt á
breathless. I was cautious but I doubted I should be able to come á
to the surface and inhale.
label: fear

text:
When my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and be á

label: anger

text:
When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered á
about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see á
them as soon as possible.
label: sadness

text:
I felt it when I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himself á
with high ranking officials.
label: disgust

text:
When I hadn't learnt my lesson and I asked the teacher to give me á
"a three" and he agreed but even he felt quite awkward.
NB: In Bulgarian schools "a three" is the second worst mark.
label: shame

text:
When I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to my á
mother and when my behaviour had been influenced by other outward á
factors.
label: guilt

text:
When you are satisfied with something	 when you achieve something á
you have striven to.
label: joy

text:
One fears many things	 for example one fears going to the á
dentist. but as far as I am concerned this feeling is connected á
with the examination session.
label: fear

text:
When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have á
been right.
label: anger

text:
For the loss of a close friend or relative	 but you feel grief á
when you are away from home	 too.
label: sadness

text: They wanted something to happen but I didn't.
label: anger

text: I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.
label: sadness

text:
I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned á
out to be gay	 but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.
label: disgust

text:
My first girlfriend. I had the feeling that she was going out á
with me only because of my defect.
label: shame

text: Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.
label: guilt

text: Having passed an exam.
label: joy

text: Having a car accident.
label: fear

text:
I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that he á
had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.
label: anger

text: The loss of a very good friend.
label: sadness

text: Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.
label: disgust

text:
Adultery with the girlfriend of a friend of mine	 of which he á
learned.
label: shame

text: Adultery with a friend's girlfriend.
label: guilt

text:
I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most á
of all when we are at a party.
label: joy

text:
I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed by á
the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly á
small distance.
label: fear

text:
I get angry with people who attain certain status without á

other people.
label: anger

text:
I feel sad when I see things done against men and nothing could á
stop it - at least I think so.
label: sadness

text:
I have experienced disgust with some people - usually double á
dealers.
label: disgust

text:
I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have to á

label: shame

text:
I feel guilty when I should have done something at any rate but I á

label: guilt

text:
I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher á
Institute.
label: joy

label: fear

text:
I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deserving á
it or when someone deceives me.
label: anger

text: When my grandfather died.
label: sadness

text: I feel disgusted with toadies	 hypocrites	 chameleons.
label: disgust

label: shame

label: guilt

text: After each successfully passed exam I am happy.

text:
A friend of mine gave birth to a child. Very dangerous delivery. á
I was afraid for her and for the baby.
label: fear

text:
I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do	 á
naturally negative. Servility	 "connections"	 impudence	 traits á
that get me mad.
label: anger

text:
My brother is a soldier. He promised to come home in a furlough á
but in the last moment he phoned and said that he could not come.
label: sadness

text: I am disgusted with liers	 hypocrites	 slanderers	 flunkeys.
label: disgust

text:
Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for - á
money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.
label: shame

text: When I have been overhastingly offending or hurting.
label: guilt

text:
After the term exams I happened to meet a person that I respect á
and of whom I think very highly. It was nice that although we see á
each other rarely he had not forgotten me.
label: joy

text:
Few years ago my father was very ill. He stayed at a hospital for á
a long time. Then I experienced that terrible feeling that I á
might lose him.
label: fear

text:
I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost á
my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.
label: anger

text:
We are several friends but our characters are very different and á
we inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myself á
don't know what to do	 I try not to hurt either of the "parties" á
because there are conflicts to which one I should belong.
label: sadness

text:
I stayed for several weeks with a friend of mine before she moved á
to live with her husband. One evening he came drunk and made an á
awful scene	 which I still remember.
label: disgust

text:
In the past I experienced this feeling almost all the time - á
wherever I went	 in different sutuations. I was small and I had á
to be taken to kindergarten	 but me the fool didn't dare to tell á
exactly where	 finally as a result I was late.
label: shame

text:
My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them. á
But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I am á
to blame for not following the advise of the others	 but it is á
not late still.
label: guilt

text:
I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student. á
Because everything turned out different from my expectations. á
Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a á
student only when I didn't expect it at all	 namely at the á
beginning of September.
label: joy

text:
In the real sense of the word I experienced fear in my first á
months in the army. During my first night of duty. The cause for á
all this was a bear. I became panic sticken (may be for the first á
time) and even forgot that I had a gun.
label: fear

text:
When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be in á
revenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights. á
Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found me á
asleep for which he sent me to the cells.
label: anger

text:
Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for á
my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years á
of my life.
label: sadness

text:
Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as a á
friend to some members of my family	 and my niece Yavanna who's á
six was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was really á
silly and at first it was ok	 but it went on and on - yukky pooh! á
You eat your snot	 etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. But á
she had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'd á
accepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better - á
it was partly having my friend there.
label: disgust

text:
In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend's á
birthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin	 really wanted me to get á
drunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit	 á
but had always been very careful - brought up to believe in á
moderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixed á
drinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and had á
to leave the table to get sick in the loo	 and later went home á
and was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And I á
didn't want to face or tell my other flatmates	 or family.
label: shame

text:
I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never my á
mother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feel á
when we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I felt á
I'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid and á
guilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.
label: guilt

text: Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.
label: joy

text: Can think of no time that I have felt fear.
label: fear

text:
Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a á
couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had á
stayed in my home	 had meals there yet took a dislike to my á
daughter.
label: anger

text: Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.
label: sadness

text:
Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle - á
driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.
label: disgust

text:
A daughter in court for staff pilfering	 she was dressed like a á
"street walker" - I had a friend form overseas with me and was á
falsely trying to impress with my family.
label: shame

text:
Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with á
baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk á
convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the á
police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.
label: guilt

text:
Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They á
were special people to me.
label: joy

text:
I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars	 me and á
companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately á
neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.
label: fear

text:
I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of á
being late	 came late again after promising to say he would be at á
work in a few minutes	 then arrived 3 hours later. He had been á
drinking.
label: anger

text:
My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away á
was very sad.
label: sadness

text: Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.
label: disgust

text:
My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because á
I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of á
not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same á
way.
label: shame

text:
I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while á
in a position of trust.
label: guilt

text:
When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had á
hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night á
out in 20 years.
label: joy

text:
While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a á
woman with two snarling dogs	 demanding we get off the property - á
via a flooded river !
label: fear

text:
A friend got angry and drove "like a lunatic" with me and others á
in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving.
label: anger

text:
A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately á
offended to provoke a reaction from the police.
label: sadness

text:
4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were á
entertaining "conservative" relations who wanted to see the first á
episode.
label: disgust

text:
A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderly á
visitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.
label: shame

text:
I had to leave an important function early because of family á
commitments. Someone else had to complete my job.
label: guilt

text:
I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first steps á
I took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoy á
being alive.
label: joy

text:
I was attacked	 standing in a doorway	 by a pack of 5 dogs	 á
alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shut á
fence.
label: fear

text:
In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends á
unfortunately are the dirt of society	 intelligent	 fashonable	 á
rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I á
didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.
label: anger

text:
I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep á
going because it was late and I would be back in the next few á
days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.
label: sadness

text:
My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the most á
expensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drove á
home and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her state á
and her actions.
label: disgust

text:
A good friend of mine told me in comfidence that once he had á
tried to commit suicide. To meet him you wouldn't think so. I á
told another friend of mine about this when she was feeling á
depressed about her twin brother's suicide. I broke a bond of á
confidentiality.
label: shame

text:
When I was young I stole something from a shop and got caught	 á
then I was taken to the police station and my parents had to come á
and get me.
label: guilt

text:
When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test)	 the á
thought of which had oppressed me	 were not on the date I had á
thought.
label: joy

text: When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.
label: fear

text:
Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm á
or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had á
behaved like a scoundrel to you	 when by his actions he has made á
you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the á
way I meant it	 is not typical for the people interrelations.
label: disgust

text:
When you betray the trust you have been given. This is connected á
with copying at a class-work at school.
label: shame

text:
When I have forgotten to warn somebody for something	 or when I á
have forgotten to bring something I have been asked for.
label: guilt

text:
When	 for example	 I was in my eleventh school year and I learned á
I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature á
National Olympiad.
label: joy

text:
When	 for example	 my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was á
necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing á
him because he is so dear to me.
label: fear

text:
When	 for example	 I was not approved to continue my studies at á
the Moscow University	 no matter that I had the highest marks and á
in general the best records of all the candidates.
label: anger

text:
When	 for example	 I left for the first time my parents and I á
went to live in Sofia.
label: sadness

text: When	 for example	 someone is calumnating.
label: disgust

text: When	 for example	 I fail in my undertakings.
label: shame

text:
For example	 when I have promised something but I haven't á
fulfilled it.
label: guilt

text:
Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the á
worst.
label: joy

text: The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.
label: fear

text: I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.
label: anger

text: Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.
label: sadness

text:
I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced this á
feeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.
label: disgust

text: I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.
label: shame

text: It happens to me quite often. I can't describe a particular case.
label: guilt

text:
Realizing one's desire	 an experienced feeling of satisfaction á
from the realization of one's desires and aims.
label: joy

text:
Fear of the loss of a close friend	 of feeling the ground slipping á
from under my feet.
label: fear

text:
Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned" á
relations.
label: anger

text:
Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent á
as they are when you are young.
label: sadness

text: Attitude to a related family.
label: disgust

text:
Exaggerating certain circumstances	 wrong attitude and evaluation á
of these circumstances.
label: shame

text: Low evaluation of other people's cares.
label: guilt

text: I won a sport contest.
label: joy

text: If a close relative's life is in danger.
label: fear

text: A close person lied to me.
label: anger

text: Getting separated from my girlfriend.
label: sadness

text: Encouter with a prostitute.
label: disgust

text: A theft committed by me.
label: shame

text: Lack of respect for my parents.
label: guilt

text: When my son was born.
label: joy

text: Before an examination.
label: fear

text: Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.
label: anger

text: After the loss of a close relative.
label: sadness

text:
When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of á
mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.
label: disgust

text:
I travelled on a bus and I forgot to punch the ticket. A ticket á
collector came in and I had to pay the fine. I did it with a feeling á
of shame.
label: shame

text: I forgot to convey an important announcement.
label: guilt

text: Meeting a loved man.
label: joy

text:
I felt a physical fear	 if I can call it this way	 today	 in the bus where á
I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't á
see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the á
side I was)	 and whose driver intended to cross in yellow á
light.
label: fear

text:
At an unjust	 or to be more precise	 at a bureaucratic treatment á
of one's personality.
label: anger

text: When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.
label: sadness

text: At the sight of an insect	 such as the black-beetle.
label: disgust

text:
When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I á
respect.
label: shame

text:
When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of á
yours and you are at the bottom of it.
label: guilt

text:
I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the á
University. I was at home	 the atmosphere was still	 though I á
myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When á
the telephone rang and...! Yes	 of course there were other á
situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of á
them.
label: joy

text:
This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the á
terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !
label: fear

text:
Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking it á
off with me	 i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because until á
that moment	 he deliberately restricted our dates. The motives á
were brought to my knowledge later.
label: anger

text:
Sometimes	 when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it á
always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it á
is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people - á
friends who I love and respect.
label: sadness

text:
Such a feeling springs up in me sometimes when I have meals at a á
catering establishment. It is a result either of the look of the á
food or when watching the way some people eat.
label: disgust

text: This happens to me when I am not prepared in a given subject.
label: shame

text:
Quite unconsciously I offended a girlfriend of mine. It was á
really worthy to pass this fact over in silence	 but I acted so	 á
because I believed I was right. In fact it often happens to me to á
feel guilt	 after I have already done the deed.
label: guilt

text: When I was admitted to the University.
label: joy

text:
I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost á
for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the á
hospital room	 while I was waiting to be called for the operation I á
felt a real fear - of the pain	 of what they were going to do to á
me	 of the unknown.
label: fear

text:
In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite á
pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory á
which he himself had never known. His information was from á
fortuitous sources.
label: anger

text:
Summer	 heavy rain	 storm - I was standing with my face stick to á
the window: the childhood	 something was going away forever this á
summer	 I was leaving my home	 I was going to study in another á
town	 for the first time I was leaving my parents	 friends	 I had á
to manage myself	 a long and loved period of my life was over - I á
was crying.
label: sadness

text: I saw in the street a man spitting.
label: disgust

text:

I started to talk imitating him.

text: Always	 and this happens often when I do not keep my word.

text:

I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a á

label: fear

label: anger

The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again	 caused á

I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of the á

label: disgust

text:
At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He á

guilt.
label: guilt

My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this á

label: sadness

text:
A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in á

My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of á

I felt fear once	 when the car in which I travelled directed á

label: fear

When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because á

Recently in the tram	 a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend á

My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call of á

About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the á

text:
I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable á

Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight but á

text: Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.

text:
A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his á

label: fear

text:
When I encountered not only with my father's lack of á

right are concerned.

text: From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.

parents.

text:
When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't take á

I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty á

I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was á

label: fear

I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. á

At an undeserved attitude toward a man	 when human personality is á

At an unworthy behaviour of a man	 pettiness	 stupidity and á

The behaviour of a colleague of mine	 which doesn't correspond to á

A honest "sliding" on the part of a girlfriend of mine. á

Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial á

I feel this feeling most often before me not before the others. á
My outside is iron but actually I'm wasting away.

I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic á

When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this often á

text:
I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder á

label: disgust

text:
I experienced long ago when I was sightseeing Bulgarians in a á

My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blame á

One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story	 nobody á

I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently á

Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with á

text:
Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often á

feeling in me.
label: sadness

text:
I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted	 who I had á
trusted	 the man who should have been my mainstay - my father. á
I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this á
emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can á
happen in this world.
label: disgust

text:
I am ashamed of the way my father behaves with my mother and á

label: shame

text:
I didn't keep a promise I had made to a man	 and in this way I á
lost his esteem and confidence in me. I caused him a lot of á
trouble.
label: guilt

text: When I was accepted as a student.
label: joy

text:
I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something á

label: fear

text:
With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come á

label: anger

text:
For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when á

label: sadness

text:
For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening	 and á

label: disgust

text:
I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed with á

label: shame

text:
Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my á

label: guilt

text:
I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was á

label: joy

text:
Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw á

label: fear

text:
I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I got á
angry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but she á
kept on telling lies.
label: anger

text: Sadness	 no	 I felt something much stronger when my father died.
label: sadness

text:
I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street. á
I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.

text:
I was ashamed of the way I deceived that I could not help a á
friend	 although it was absolutely possible for me. Nothing was á

label: shame

text:
I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my á

text:

label: sadness

text:
I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told them á

text:
The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary á

label: guilt

text:
I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted á

text:
I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man on á

text:
I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare for á

label: anger

text:
I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither á

label: sadness

text:
I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent words á

label: disgust

text:
At an exam in pharmacology I tried to prompt a coleague (she á

remark.
label: shame

text:
My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I still á
haven't had time to see her.
label: guilt

text:
When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me á

label: joy

text:
I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of á

label: fear

text:
Some time ago I was disgusted with the "cleanness" of the á

label: disgust

text:
We were at a football match and when we were leaving the stadium á
(the stadium was packed with people) and I lost my shoe in the á
crowd. Our attempts to find it didn't give any result and I had á
to go home without one shoe. In other words to cross the whole á
town !
label: shame

text:
I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague á
of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good á
notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know á
why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was á

label: guilt

text:
When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many á
people about my applying for this institute and I decided to á
prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any á
preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.
label: joy

text:
Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't á
wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness á
(and so it is now).
label: fear

text:
A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the one á
who was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and told á
the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call and á
threatened me.
label: anger

text:
Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every á
school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left á
each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now á
I remember about it quite often.
label: sadness

text:
It was at a comsomol(??) meeting	 the last one because we were to á
graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel á
disgusted.
label: disgust

text:
I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders	 my á
coevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreign á
friends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then we á
roused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I á
didn't utter a word for two days	 then I went to apologize.
label: shame

text:
When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our á
mark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my á
classmates about the scolding they had got at home. My first á
mark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for more á
than that and I put down "very good" for fear of being scolded. á
Naturally my parents guessed all about it. They rebuked me for á
what I had done.
label: guilt

text:
When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - á
floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general á
one).
label: joy

text:
I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and á
directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it á
rolled by and hit me.
label: fear

text:
My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance á
movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his á
health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the á
nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old á
he was (79).
label: anger

text:
My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we á
had to get separated again.
label: sadness

text:
I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that was á
human in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her for á
the eighth of March and asked for a foreign parfume instead.
label: disgust

text:
I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well á
prepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and I á
couldn't answer.
label: shame

text:
I had undertaken to help my sister for her class work but some á
unexpected circumstances prevented me from doing that.
label: guilt

text:
I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard á
about it over the phone	 I didn't believe it at first.
label: joy

text: I had worries about a certain illness.
label: fear

text:
I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased á
to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had á
misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that á
it was done by a "good" acquaintance of mine.
label: anger

text:
When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him á
understand I felt miserable.
label: sadness

text:
I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my á
affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if á
nothing had happened.
label: disgust

text:
I feel shame when I have made a promise	 I can't keep it and this á
has negative effects which are caused by my behavior.
label: shame

text:
I felt it when I came home after the examination session and I á
said I had not passed my last exam.
label: guilt

text:
I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry á
examination.
label: joy

text:
This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study á
there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance á
Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.
label: fear

text:
I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently	 á
the pedology lecturer was the cause.
label: anger

text:
This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car á
accident.
label: sadness

text:
I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car would á
run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.
label: disgust

text: I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.
label: shame

text:
The sense of guilt came over me too	 when I interrupted my á
studies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! They á
believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.
label: guilt

text:
I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant	 at my working á
place	 I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at á
the Higher Agricultural Institute.
label: joy

text:
Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue á
duty as a soldier.
label: fear

text:
When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his á
own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.
label: anger

text: The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.
label: sadness

text:
I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts of á
quarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his á
living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.
label: disgust

text:
Some time ago I promised to meet an acquaintance of mine and to á
carry him some promised papers. I haven't done it until this day. á
Now I feel quite awkward when I meet him.
label: shame

text:
A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue my á
studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.
label: guilt

text:
After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had á
got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he á
feels glad.
label: joy

text:
Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance á
examinations.
label: fear

text:
I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be á
present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.
label: anger

text:
When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for á
my early years	 for the freedom and the carefree years of á
childhood.
label: sadness

text: I feel disgusted with the bootlickers	 with helpless people.
label: disgust

text: I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.
label: shame

text:
I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days á
later he died.
label: guilt

text:
I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry	 I was very excited á
because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam á
very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.
label: joy

text:
Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations á
most of all. I remember I was horror stricken before my á
microbiology exam	 because it was a decisive one.
label: fear

text:
It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a á
celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned á
out that there was no audience at all because everyone had á
pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got á
furious.
label: anger

text:
When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I á
can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just á
parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.
label: sadness

text:
In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords	 quite á
intelligent people	 warned me I had to move in the nearest á
future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I á
couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them á
threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my á
luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was á
quite  disappointed and disgusted.
label: disgust

text:
During our last exarcise in agricultural machines we went out in á
the yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to have á
fulfilled our task well	 because when our teacher came and asked á
me a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because he á
didn't deserve it.
label: shame

text:
I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. I á
felt guilty before her.
label: guilt

text:
When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is now á
my girlfriend).
label: joy

text: I fear before each exam.
label: fear

text: When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.
label: anger

text: When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.
label: sadness

text: When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.
label: disgust

text:
When I wasn't well prepared for a terminal exam and the teacher á
tried to give me a three by asking me some very easy questions. I á
burned with shame then.
label: shame

text:
When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home á
because she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by a á
man. But it remained undone.
label: guilt

text:
I feel joy usually after each taken exam	 the last one was in á
February.
label: joy

text:
It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk á
and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol. á
I felt fear of what could have happened.
label: fear

text:
I felt anger at my last exam	 I felt angry with our teacher	 á
because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.
label: anger

text:
I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it á
happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness	 I think á
I can call it so.
label: sadness

text:
I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him á
but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.
label: disgust

text:
Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit a á
party where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On the á
next day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had said á
and done on the night before.
label: shame

text:
Last year I put off an exam for the autumn session without á
knowing if there was a supplementary examination session. When I á
came home with my exam unpassed I felt guilty before my parents á
when I remembered how much they had done for me.
label: guilt

text: When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.
label: joy

text:
I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I á
could not feel it at all.
label: fear

text:
I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a á
few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.
label: anger

text:
When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia á
and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the á
events that were taking place there.
label: sadness

text:
I felt disgust with alcohol in general when a close friend of á
mine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and it á
was quite shameful.
label: disgust

text:
I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceived á
them.
label: shame

text:
I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accident á
but as my parents did not know who was to blame	 they punished my á
brother because I had no driving licence and they thought it á
impossible that had driven the car.
label: guilt

text:
I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural á
Institute.
label: joy

text:
I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last á
year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.
label: fear

text:
That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal á
marks.
label: anger

text:
I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something á
had irrevocably gone away from me.
label: sadness

text:
I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag	 to mock	 to á
interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class á
with her in our first year.
label: disgust

text:
That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then was á
cought.
label: shame

text:
I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had á
enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.
label: guilt

text:
I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my á
sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the á
telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.
label: joy

text:
It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and á
told us my father was badly injured in an accident.
label: fear

text:
I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the á
institute in the first classifying	 in spite of the high mark I á
had got at the entrance examination.á
label: anger

text:
Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from my á
home town.
label: sadness

text:
I feel disgust with my first boyfriend who made fun of our love á
in an abominable way.
label: disgust

text:
I have always felt ashamed for some people's behavior to their á
too old parents. I have felt hurt and shy when they have left á
them to the mercy of fate.
label: shame

text:
I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and have á
to tell them I have failed an exam.
label: guilt

text:
Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second á
birthday.
label: joy

text: When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.
label: fear

text:
A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experienced á
this feeling when I tried to chase her out.
label: anger

text: After my father's death.
label: sadness

text: With an alcoholic.
label: disgust

text:
Once I had dinner at an elegant restaurant and I did not have á
enough money to pay the bill. There were a lot of people there á

label: shame

text:
Something very unpleasant happened when I was a soldier and I was á
directly involved in it.
label: guilt

text:
I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for á
a long period	 my father came back home.
label: joy

text:
I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left á
alone in this unfamiliar country.
label: fear

text:
I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely á
partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and á
anger.
label: anger

text: When my first girlfriend an I left each other.
label: sadness

text:
During a summer holiday at a bar I happened to see a dead to the á
world woman.
label: disgust

text: When I first had a sexual intercourse.
label: shame

text:
I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner set á
quite involuntarily.
label: guilt

text:
When I got a message that I was employed as a nurse at a á
kindergarten.
label: joy

text: When I first sat for an entrance examination.
label: fear

text:
When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated á
teacher and a man	 slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite á
