label: anger

text: When I got separated from my first love.
label: sadness

text:
Many times	 when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated á
physically me and my mother.
label: disgust

text:
When for the first and the last time I tried to crib and the á
teacher was with her back to me but right when I was taking the á
materials out she turned round and saw me.
label: shame

text:
When at times unconscienciously I speak to my mother in a high á
tome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.
label: guilt

text:
Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He á
telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
label: joy

text: Watching a horror movie with friends.
label: fear

text:
The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad á
then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.
label: anger

text:
The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was á
of my own age	 there were many of my own friends present	 as well á
as her family etc.
label: sadness

text:
Disgust for a person who treated me badly	 and has treated other á
people similarly - including lying	 hiding facts	 being á
deceitful	 unfair	 etc.
label: disgust

text:
Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yelling á
and screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - in á
effect lowering myself to their level.
label: shame

text:
Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospital á
after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.
label: guilt

text:
Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She á
wasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinking  of á
leaving the job only after 2 days employment.
label: joy

text:
Walking home at night after university - part of the way	 there á
are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the á
thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.
label: fear

text:
When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he á
knows needs doing.
label: anger

text:
When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother á
who had passed away about a month ago.
label: sadness

text:
With a woman who had walked into my place of employment and á
urinated on the floor in front of everyone.
label: disgust

text:
When I found a letter addressed "To Mum" by my son	 6 months á
later	 he begged me not to sell his new shoes which he messed up á
after wearing them for the first time.
label: shame

text:
When I had lied to a friend/son about some things we had á
discussed and I had to be one better.
label: guilt

text:
Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very á
close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.
label: joy

text:
I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibate á
and alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibited á
sexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fear á
through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings á
despite my own being hurt in the process.
label: fear

text:
In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members of á
society for exploiting the Polynesian people	 dawn raids by á
Police (Martin Luther King	 Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a á
reflection of my own shortcomings.
label: anger

text:
Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square	 Aotea square. á
Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I á
went into the role of a performing clown.
label: sadness

text:
I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself	 my á
homework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention. á
Especially in learning another language.
label: disgust

text:
I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my á
parent father	 shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived á
self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as á
I am.
label: shame

text:
I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guilty á
at being a student when other people were not. Guilt about being á
a potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid this á
emotion)
label: guilt

text:
When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing á
well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd á
taught her at 6 yrs	 then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last á
3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for á
Council.
label: joy

text:
A Maori language oral test	 yeaterday - Although I had studied á
intensely - once in the examiners room "I blew it" -  I was so á
nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important	 but I á
got only blankness.
label: fear

text:
A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not á
as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She á
implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time	 á
and taking 3 University exams part time).
label: anger

text:
When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attacked á
me verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discarded á
because his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgust á
saddned me.
label: sadness

text:
People who came to our home - and requested "Put out your smoke". á
That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even á
politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to á
the situation.
label: disgust

text:
Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual family á
friends dinner. Told "Not to Speak". The attitude by him was á
negative/I was in mid 20s	 I had done many things - a wide range á
of experiences. Probably greater than he.
label: shame

text:
Not attending school	 when  am not sick - but in need of mental á
rest. Staff on your return query your "sickness" - it is easier á
in N.Z. to be sick	 rather than confide other personal reasons á
etc.
label: guilt

text: My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.
label: joy

text:
A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a á
small Lazer).
label: fear

text:
A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December á
last year.
label: anger

text:
My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - "Lord Grey" died in his sleep - His á

label: sadness

text: A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.
label: disgust

text:
I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did not á
accept my Visa !
label: shame

text: When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.
label: guilt

text: When my daughter was born.
label: joy

text:
When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I á
felt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.
label: fear

text:
When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving. á
We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore á
would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the á
time.
label: anger

text: When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.
label: sadness

text:
When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with á

label: disgust

text:
When I was unable to respond to a welcome in my indigenous á
language of Maori at an important function where I was the only á

label: shame

text:
When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important á
family occasion that I should not have missed.
label: guilt

text:
Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5 á
years	 at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the á
"paper work" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming á
through the customs gate.
label: joy

text:
I caught a huge eel on a fishing line which I had pulled into the á
boat. I cut the line and threw the whole lot back into the water. á
Later that day and about ten miles away I went swimming and á
someone made the comment wondering how far eels could swim	 I á
abruptly ended swimming for fear at an unseen eel for a few days á
until we had left the district.
label: fear

text:
My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it á
was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his á
own life for the next 6-12 months	 then told me the day before it á
was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the á
preceding week.
label: anger

text:
I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to á
leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole á
new set of friends	 leaving them at the airport was sad and á
traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I á
wouldn't see many of them again.
label: sadness

text:
After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was á
scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want á
a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way á
through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and á
continue my studies.
label: fear

text:
This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagrees á
with me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and I á
always end up feeling angry at her and myself for fighting so á
much over unimportant trivial matters.
label: anger

text:
When my grandmother	 who has been living with us for 14 years	 á
had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been á
quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes á
me feel really sad.
label: sadness

text:
A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded to á
show pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most people á
had had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading	 á
unmoral manner - especially females exposing and flaunting á
themselves with no shame or embarassment.
label: disgust

text:
Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I began á
to feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it was á
only "the thing to do"	 and not really an act of love.
label: shame

text:
This feeling of guilt really applies to moral/religious views. I á
(being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe in á
and had a sexual relationship with my boyfriend. Many months á
later	 when I was doing some deeper self analysis I began to feel á
guilty and realized that I had gone against what I wanted for á
myself and my future.
label: guilt

text:
My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise á
birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along á
too.
label: joy

text:
My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway á
if I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back I á
start thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and are á
perhaps dead.
label: fear

text:
Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organise á
a roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn at á
doing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can't á
be bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.
label: anger

text:
So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved á
into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially á
my family - forever.
label: sadness

text:
A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him but á
is quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.
label: disgust

text: NO RESPONSE.
label: shame

text:
I did not attend a social studies observation class for 1 whole á
week (I am a student trainee teacher). Anyway the other teachers á
thought this was okay because the teacher I was supposed to á
observe was not well liked. The teacher was in fact really nice á
to me - but I wanted to get out of teaching a hard topic he had á
given me.
label: guilt

text:
Passing my pharmacy exams which meant my tertiary education for á

label: joy

text:
When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to á

text:
When my boyfriend wouldn't dance with me on my graduation night á

label: anger

text:
When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2 á

text:
My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me á

label: disgust

text: I found I was pregnant and unmarried.
label: shame

text:
When I had to go to reconciliation before converting to á

label: guilt

text:
Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special á

label: joy

text:
I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at a á

label: fear

text: Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.
label: anger

text:
This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish our á
relationship due to some circumstances between her and her á
family. I was really sad	 hurt and couldn't really find any á
reason why am I still living. Is this life is all about ? This á
was one of few question which crept up vividly every time I á
thought about what had happened.
label: sadness

text:
I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body with á
drugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usually á
for an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they do á
things stupidly and unjustly.
label: disgust

text: NO RESPONSE.
label: shame

text: This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.
label: guilt

text: Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e.	 ill feeling.

label: fear

When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self - á

label: anger

text: When boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.
label: sadness

text:
Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering	 á

label: disgust

text: When ditched - divorced by husband.
label: shame

text:
When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of a á

label: guilt

text:
My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really á
happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me á

label: joy

text:
That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my á

at 14.
label: fear

text:
(1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a year á

label: anger

text:
My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until two á

label: sadness

text:
A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father. á
I only knew the child and had not come into contact with either á
parent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event and á

label: disgust

text:
When my natural parents name would show up on papers and not my	 á

label: shame

text:
I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to á

label: guilt

text: Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.

text:
When a man	 a stranger to me	 personally insulted a close woman á

When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of á

text:
When I went to explain to a lecturer whom I liked that the work á

label: shame

label: guilt

text:
When my lover and I felt like we had gone full circle. And our á

text:
My daughter was 2 yrs she went up to a colt tried to hit it. It á
turned on her and kicked her over the heart	 sent her flying á
through the air. I left my mother and sister to deal to her as á
they are nurses. I felt I didn't want to know if she was going to á
die	 it was just too much.
label: fear

text: My anger is with men	 their inability to be human (not all men).
label: anger

text:
The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed	 á
hitch-hiking to work.
label: sadness

text:
With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanting to send the All Blacks to South á

label: disgust

text:
That my brother and father are into alcohol	 two men with á

label: shame

text:
When I betrayed my lover	 she told me something in confidence	 I á
felt at the time I had to relay the information back to the á
person concerned	 as I felt the situation volitile	 did this á
without telling my lover	 she felt like piggy in the middle	 as á
she was not directly concerned. Maybe you could call it gossip I á
felt different after I had slept on it. If I had waited	 thought	 á
NOW I would not have done it.
label: guilt

text:
A good friend	 the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me á
from the pews (I am in the choir) and shook my hand during the á
time for an informal "greeting" in the church service. She said a á
few words.
label: joy

text:
I walked up the main street of Auckland at 10 o'clock at night. I á
expected it to be very active with people	 gangs	 fast cars etc	 á
thought it was actually quite quiet	 though also oppressive. I á
walked about half a mile and bought a drink along the way.
label: fear

text:
Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which I á
had made for myself. It was during a long telephone call after I á
had just made it and put it in the oven warming drawer.
label: anger

text:
Sitting in a bus	 I heard behind	 the voice of a girl I was á
friendly with. After her talking for some time with another girl á

played very badly.
label: anger

text:
When a friend of mine told me that he was going to commit á
suicide.
label: sadness

text: A TV program on whale-hunting.
label: disgust

text:
Family discord and uneasiness due to something I did not á

text:
When I passed my driving test	 as it was the fifth time that I á

text: When my mother was robbed in a shop.

text:
I was given an exam which I thought did not measure at all my á

text:
When I saw the film "Johnny got his gun" which deals with the á

label: sadness

text:
Some friends and I were having lunch.  Someone said something á

label: disgust

text:
I was alone in the bus when I tripped and fell	 and dropped all á

label: shame

text:
As I was not paying attention	 my little brother fell off the á
table.
label: guilt

text: When I passed the university entrance exam.
label: joy

text:
One night	 while I was sleeping	 I woke up suddenly with the á

text: When my brother was held up and robbed.
label: anger

text: When I see someone vomitting.
label: disgust

text: When I fell head on in a fountain.

text:
I had to undergo an operation in Summer and so my family had to á
stay at home during the holidays.  I felt guilty	 above all á
because of my brothers.
label: guilt

text:
I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long á
time.
label: joy

text:
I had decided to propose to the man I liked to make a trip á
together.  One day	 during breakfast I told him my idea.  I was á
afraid of his not accepting it and that the idea would end up as á
a failure.
label: fear

text:
A person I trusted a lot gave me many false explanations to á
justify a wrong action.
label: anger

text:
I was having breakfast with a classmate and suddenly I began to á

long time.
label: sadness

text:
During lunch with some classmates	 a priest was also there.  He á
was eating desperately as if someone was going to take his plate á
away.  He did it with gluttony.  He wiped his hands on his suit á
several times and it was full of crumbs.
label: disgust

text:
When a professor caught me absent-minded and not paying attention á
to what he was saying.
label: shame

text:
One day	 I was alone on duty when a patient choked while eating.  á
I ran to her and tried to make her breath	 but it was too late.
label: guilt

text:
At a party	 on New Year's Eve	 I met on old friend whom I had not á

label: joy

text:
Once I failed seven subjects at school and I was terrified to á
give my report card to my father.  I left it on the table and went to á
bed very early in order to avoid him seeing me.
label: fear

text:
When	 after drinking a glass of water	 I found a cockroach walking á

label: anger

text:
I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we have á
been writing to each other for a long time.  The last time I went á
to her city	 just to see her	 I was disappointed to see how great á
the distance between us was.
label: sadness

text:
They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some á

label: disgust

text:
The girl with whom I was going around had been forbidden to be á
alone with me in the house.  We paid no attention to this á
prohibition but one day her parents appeared and I jumped out of á
the window.  They saw me.
label: shame

text:
I was driving a friend's car	 and I got close to the pavement to á

label: guilt

text:
Every time	 in the last few days	 when my girlfriend told me that á
she loves me.
label: joy

text:
I stayed alone in the dark at night in the mountain	 waiting for á

text:
We were at school	 in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were á
watching a film	 and just behind me two classmates were bothering á
me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)  á
by hitting one of them.
label: anger

text:
[ During a summer holiday a French girl and I had becoe back á

label: sadness

text:
Once I had to clean a lavatory which was obstructed.  It was in a á

label: disgust

text:
In a Mathematics class	 the professor asked me a question and I á

label: shame

text:
When I lost my study grant without having attended any exam in á

Once	 I accidentally injured a boy in the eye and he almost lost á

On the occasion of assignment of tasks and responsibilities in á

Moving to an unknown place	 away from the familiar surroundings á

label: sadness

text:
While shopping	 a person close to us created an uncomfortable á

label: shame

text:
Incomprehension and repression towards a child's behaviour	 á

label: guilt

text:
In a dark street at 4 o'clock in the night and there was á

label: fear

text:
When they broke the artistic work of several weeks.  Changes were á

do this.
label: anger

text:
When the train taking me to my military service left the station	 á

label: sadness

text:
A situation of overt unfairness	 manipulation of people and its á

label: disgust

text:
A children's film in which I played a clown	 with spotlights	 á

label: shame

text: When a close classmate failed a year.
label: guilt

text:
I was talking to a friend and he said something which was very á

label: joy

text:
When I was young I saw a horror film.  Then when I went to sleep	 á

label: fear

text:
In a confrontation with a person	 he provoked me several times á
till I reacted in an angry way.  Fortunately there were no á

label: anger

text: I was watching a sad film and it affected me deeply.
label: sadness

text:
When I was reading a book.  It had nothing to do with the book á

label: disgust

text:
In class I had to say something aloud and people reacted  by á

label: shame

text:
In an exam I answered the questions rather carelessly and á
afterwards I thought that the exam would have been better had I á

label: guilt

text:
When I knew that there were	 at last	 no problems in making a á
journey that I had been wanting to make for a long time.
label: joy

text: It was more that fear - anguish -that I felt before my last exam.
label: fear

text:
When I had an argument with my best friend and I thought that I á
was right and she was not.
label: anger

text:
When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I á
had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.
label: sadness

text:
The first time I saw a pornographic film	 all that in practice is á
so beautiful but on the screen appered as something mechanical	 á

label: disgust

text:
When I stated sharply something I was not very sure of and a few á
days later I was shown to be wrong.
label: shame

text:
When I do or say something inappropriate which hurts people close á

label: guilt

text:
When a study tour got confirmed	 I was happy all the time till    á
the tour began.
label: joy

text:
I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fence á

that they would come for me any time.
label: fear

text:
When I knew that they would not give me a transfer from one á
university to another.  I began to insult the educatioon á
authorities and the government	 I ended up at the door.
label: anger

text:
We went to visit my mother at the residence.  She was crying and á
said that she was about to die.  I believed all her complaints á
and continously thought of the possibility of loosing her.
label: sadness

text:
My dog had been run over and died near the house.  We had to pick á

label: disgust

text:
A professor was going to read aloud in class a composition of á
mine in which I had criticized some political attitudes and also á
some class-mates.   I was ashamed at having written that.
label: shame

text:
In an exam when I answered the questions with very little á
assurance due to insufficiet preparation.
label: guilt

text:
When I received my report card in C.O.U.  I was afraid of obtaining á

label: joy

text:
I was at the cinema with my sister and her boyfriend.  A man á

label: fear

text:
My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's and á

label: anger

text: I had failed some subjects in mathematics.
label: sadness

text:
I was at the table at a French friend's house.  They served me a á

text:
This morning I spent a lot of time on my toilet and missed the á

label: shame

text:
I was alone at home when I broke a figure and then mended it.  A á

label: guilt

text:
When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returned á

label: joy

text:
When I was caught by the police and was kept with a group of á

label: fear

text:
When I was the target of a great many insults and completely á
unfair accusations of a large group of people.
label: anger

text: When my best friend died	 at the age of 16.
label: sadness

text:
When I entered a brothel and saw two sailors with a young á

label: disgust

text:
When I was in a religious school my teacher showed me up in front á

label: shame

text:
Having suffered a not very pretty sight	 I reacted by uttering á

label: guilt

text:
When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very á
long time.
label: joy

text:
I had an accident in which I hurt my eye.  I was afraid of having á

label: fear

text: When I was accused of something I had not done.
label: anger

text: A close friend died.
label: sadness

text:
I slipped and fell in to a puddle and people started looking at á

text: I made another person cry for an unjustified cause.
label: guilt

text:
I received an unexpected letter from a friend I had met a short á

label: joy

text:
I was walking with another person when a "gang" separted us and á

label: fear

text:
A certain person started to say dreadful things very calmly	 I á

label: anger

text:
A certain person whom I respect and esteem a lot pays me no á

label: sadness

text:
In a bus I fell sick and vomitted in a bag.  The entire situation á

label: disgust

text:
A person (a male) told me that he liked me.  He has a problem	 he á

label: shame

text:
I rejected a person whom I had always thought to be a friend.  I á

realized it before and at having hurt him.
label: guilt

text:
When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money I á

label: joy

text:
When my relatives and I were in a car going slowly on a frozen á

label: fear

text:
My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and á

label: anger

text: I was going away	 leaving a dear person behind.
label: sadness

text:
I visited a place in Morocco where they worked the leather.  I á

label: disgust

label: shame

text:
I was in a cafe with another person when	 suddenly	 several close á

label: guilt

label: joy

When I saw a film in which the man suffered from an illness and    á

text:
[ When I act thinking that I know everything and I then realize á

label: guilt

text:
[ Any situation in everyday life has this emotional sense	 in á

label: joy

On a dark night I felt that there were several people near me á

When I learned that several people had died in the street due to  á

label: disgust

text:
I was with a group of people and everybody told me to do or say á

label: shame

text:
In a situation with my girlfriend I took a decision.  Later when á
I thought about it	 I realized that it was an erroneous decision.
label: guilt

text:
One night	 at a friend's place I realized that I had everything I á

label: joy

text:
During a demonstration I climbed up the closed central door of a á

label: fear

text:
When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he á

label: anger

text:
A friend of mine was hurt as he thought that our relationship was á
not the same as before and something had gone wrong.
label: sadness

text:
When I was young	 one day in the car we fell sick and ended up á
vomitting on each other.
label: disgust

text:
The parents of a friend of mine surprised us and another couple á
sleeping in thier place.
label: shame

text:
A friend of mine felt bad because of something I had done to á
something that belonged to him.
label: guilt

text:
When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty of á

label: fear

text: [ No description.]
label: anger

text:
When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked á

label: sadness

text:
I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an        á

label: disgust

text:
I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes á

attention by talking to them.
label: shame

text:
When I used an adjective for a person without knowing what it á

label: guilt

text: When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.
label: joy

label: fear

text:
I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.  I á

label: anger

text: At my grandfather's death.
label: sadness

text: Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.
label: disgust

text:
At a concert an old man arrived and began to danse	 sing and do á

label: shame

text:
I had an argument with a friend of mine.  She would not let me á
speak and then I began to shout at her.  She got angry and left	 á
I did not try to prevent her from leaving.
label: guilt

text:
When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film á
marathon I wanted to see.
label: joy

text:
We were on the road in a car when a lorry bypassed us.  We had to á

label: fear

text:
I had applied for a job and they had assured me that the exams á
would take place a few months later.  A week later I went to á

label: anger

text:
I received a letter from some friends	 who do not live in Madrid	 á
telling me that they would not come on holiday.  I had arranged á
everythiing for them.
label: sadness

text: I found a big	 black spider near a bag of food.
label: disgust

text:
I was in a very small class and the professor said something á
about me that made everyone look at me at the same time.
label: shame

text:
I had arranged to meet my friends at a certain place	 and I was á
with other people.  My friends did not arrive and the people who á
were with me began to get tired.  My friends were one hour late.
label: guilt

text: The man I am going around with gave me a very special present.
label: joy

text:
I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made	 which á
I should not have made.
label: fear

text:
My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied á
up the house	 although I had been working all morning and she had á

label: anger

text:
At my grandfather's funeral.  I remembered that the thing he á
liked and respected most was earth	 I thought that he had á
attained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.
label: sadness

text:
I had to wash my grandmother because she did not get to the á
bathroom on time.
label: disgust

text:
In a very crowded shop I was distracted and missed my turn in the á
queue.  A woman who was behind me began to shout at me asking me á
either to pay more attention or to leave.
label: shame

text:
When I was very young	 one day	 I kicked my grandmother and á
caused her an injury which took a long time to heal.
label: guilt

text:
When I saw a friend of mine	 whom I had not seen for a long time á
and I had lost his address and telephone number.
label: joy

text:
I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and started á

label: fear

text: When I saw a car run over a child	 out of carelessness.
label: anger

text:
I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite a á
lot for it.
label: sadness

text: When I was walking in a field which had a lot of manure.
label: disgust

text:
I liked a boy and I would feel shy and then blush.  The more I á

label: shame

text:
I am not very affectionate and I feel guilty as I do not give as á
much affection as I receive.
label: guilt

text:
I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting á
for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop	 a  á
woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I á
was afraid that I would not see my friend	 but at last we found á
him.
label: joy

text:
I was walking down a little village at night.  There was nobody á
in the steet.  A dog began to bark	 I felt that it was following á
me.  Then I began to run	 the other dogs started barking too.  At á
last I arrived home.
label: fear

text: My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.
label: anger

text: I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.
label: sadness

text: Finding a hair in the soup.
label: disgust

text:
I was at the University dining room	 alone	 and at a table next á

join them.  I refused but she insisted.  All the others started á
looking at me and I had to move to their table.
label: shame

text:
I had promised to say goodbye to a person who was going on a á
trip	 and I did not turn up.
label: guilt

text:
I was on holidays	 and I was going to meet a friend whom I had á
not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.
label: joy

text:
We were camping in the mountains	 and a friend and I went for a á

label: fear

text:
I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me á
and he lost it.
label: anger

text: To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.
label: sadness

text: Ever since I have been a child	 the sight of any kind of wound.
label: disgust

text: At the seaside	 when a wave suddenly came and took off my bikini.
label: shame

text:
One night	 I went out with some friends for dinner and I did not á
tell my parents that I would come back late.  I thought of á
phoning but in the end I did not.  When I arrived home	 my á
parents were very worried.
label: guilt

text:
My sister in law was about to have a child	 and there were some á

was all right.
label: joy

text: Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.
label: fear

text:
I gave some personal information to a friend of mine	 and he told á
it to some others who were implicated in the affair.
label: anger

text:
The holidays come to an end	 and the next day we had to go back á

label: sadness

text:
There was a cat on the street.  It had been run over and its head was á

label: disgust

text:
At a meeting with over one hundred people	 they decided who had to speak á

label: shame

text:
I had a small argument with a relative and some other people got á
implicated.  It resulted in a proper row.
label: guilt

text:
Last course	 when I passed with good marks three subjects which I had á

label: joy

text: I was attacked by a man at a bus stop at night.
label: fear

text:
My mother told me that I could not go to the mountains.  Despite á

label: anger

text:
When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did á

label: sadness

text:
I was drinking coffee in a cafe and I found a piece of scrubber á

label: disgust

text:
When I went to my boyfriend's house for lunch and saw his á

label: shame

text:
At school	 I did not tell the teacher that it was me who á
had laughed	 and she punished the entire class by making them á

label: guilt

text:
One evening	 I was with a group of friends having a talk.  There á

label: joy

text:
We were walking in the park at night.  It was very dark and very á

label: fear

text:
[ One day I arrived home rather tired and found the house..... In á

label: anger

text:
I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not á
have the money to do it.
label: sadness

text:
In a film there was a scene in which a rat was sliding on a bed	 á

one of the actors.
label: disgust

text:
I was swimming in the river and I lost the top of my bikini.  I á
did not notice it and came out of water.  There was a á
disagreeable classmate watching the scene.
label: shame

text:
At a party	 several comments were made about the personal á
situation of one of the people present.  She was rather affected á

label: guilt

text:
It was Saturday	 my duties were over for a few hours and I could á

label: joy

text:
One night	 I was alone at home.  My fear was caused by some á
strange noises which put my imagination to work.
label: fear

text:
When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a á
certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.
label: anger

text:
I felt alone among a large number of people.  I was sad to see á
that nobody cared about what was happening to me.
label: sadness

text: I saw a sort of black worm being attacked by many ants.
label: disgust

text: When I met a friend of mine after several months.
label: shame

text:
I was going to my village	 after having been rather oppressed in á

label: joy

text:
I was watching a procession during the Holy week	 and a penitent á

label: fear

text:
My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to me á

text:
" I have been hearing rumours that you have not been allowing á

label: anger

text:
One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my á

One day I went to town to get my grocery.  On my way back	 I took á

text:
I had gone to aa bookshop to buy some books.  Somehow	 I got very á
cross with the security guard checking through what I had bought. á
 I lost my temper and screamed at him.  Later I felt very ashamed á
at myself as a lot of people I know were there.

text:
I remember deceiving my brother	 I told him that I was going to á

This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston and á

I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen.  I was in á

I was annoyed this particular day as it seemad that the odds were á

It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my á

text:
Dad had just married his second wife (my step-mother) and I did á

consequences.  Nobody ever got to know that it was me who had á
done it.
label: guilt

He discovered that we were given K150 per year for books.

This happened recently	 I  was in the dining hall and one of my á

I send a word to my boss through my servant telling him that I á

text:
After a jogging session I had severe abdominal cramps and this á

text:
A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept á

 I really felt like hiding.

 seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been á

After a long time (of no communication with him	 physical á

Birds had made nests in our thatched roof and they were flying á

On Christmas day a drunk man came to our house without a shirt á

My baby sister was 2-3 months old and when I was trying to get á

When I came back from work one day	 the friends of my son told me á

The teacher of one course gave me 10 questions with sub-questions á

label: disgust

I forgot that the course instructor had directed us to go for á

I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had been á

I am disgusted at the number of second year students who are á

Getting drunk and creating a lot of trouble at a place I respect á

I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every á

 I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the á

When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard á

text:
When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (a á

When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary á

text:
At boarding school someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed.  á
When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at my á

label: sadness

text:
My room-mate was drunk	 he vomited on the floor and fell face á

As a kid my mother caught me stealing sugar and giving it to a á

text:
I felt vvery happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies.  á

 I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.

This is an incident that many of us witness in our everyday life á

myself -"what is life?".  It is one hell of a place where á
everyone is after someone else.  One waits to cut the throat of á
the other one just for a living	 (money).  When I think about á
such things - the purpose of life	 etc	 I feel very disgusted and á
dejected.
label: disgust

text:
This is an event I will never forget.  I am considered a good á
mimic.  This particular day we were waiting for a professor á
to take her class.  This  professor had a peculiar accent and a á
very horrible way of lecturing and to top it all we had this á
class at the fag end of the day.  So this particular day I got á
into my element and started imitating the professor	 and the á
professor entered the class right in the middle of it .  I was á
unaware of her presence	 some of my friends tried to warn me but á
it was of no avail as I was too engrossed in mimicing.  Then I á
suddenly noticed the silence and turned around to see her á
entering the class.  I do not know till today if she actually saw á
what I had been doing or she had completely ignored it.  Through  á
out that lecture I died of shame.  All the more shameful was the á
fact that she gave me a character certificate.
label: shame

text:
I am afraid of my academic results as I will face several á
problems.  I am scared of my limitations and the unlimited á

label: fear

text:
I quarrelled with my brothers (twins) at home on saturday.  One á
of them studies in a private school and the other one is á
repeating his form five.  They do not know what they are doing.  á
They follow every word of their teachers	 books and systems.  á
They always try to rationalize their bad acts by some game and á
they are satisfied with their awkward life.  I have tried to á
persuade them very often but have failed.  This time I had a á
fight as they have no voluntary spirit (they did not polish the á
floor).
label: anger

text:
I have been thinking of changing my major for a few months.  My á
original major was Chinese language and it blocks my way.  I have á
to face many problems at the sametime and I do not know what is á
real and virtuous.  I do not know if I am not interested in á
Chinese or if there are other factors which make me sad.  I am á
not very clear on what I can do for the study of Communication á
and Journalism.  I am not clear about what I can do.  What are á
the limitations ?   I hesitate but I feel more adjusted now.
label: sadness

text:
I had been forced to get together with strange and disgusting á
classmates.  The things they talked about disgusted me and made á
me feel ill at ease.  I knew that I would feel unhappy if I á
stayed there but I was defeated by the social norms.
label: disgust

text:
I had obviously done the work badly but my class-mates of the á

work.
label: shame

text:
I had not done my assignment seriously.  I only pretended to á
finish the work as the work did not have any meaning for me.  The á

text:
When I read the newspaper that morning I found my candidature á
number on the admission list of the Chinese university.  I was á
satisfied and happy and the cumulative anxiety disappeared.  I á
only wanted to cry out that I had succeeded.
label: joy

text:
Tutorial again !  A fearful feeling came to me when I sat on the á
chair and looked at my fellow students all around.  I was really á
scared that they would ask me some questions or challenge the á
ideas that I had presented.
label: fear

text:
The trick was really intolerable.  They hid it	 and I was worried á
and restless all day.  When I saw them I really wanted to slap á
each one of them.
label: anger

text:
A and I were walking along the new Asia stairway to the Chung Chi á
college for our lecture and I saw him with her.  He put one arm á
around her shoulder and laugher brightly and joyfully.  I did not á
dare and did not want to look	 just walked by them quickly.  The á
interest of talking to A disappeared and I just wanted to remain á
silent.  But I did not want A to know and so I left him and went á
to F.  I should have expected this to happen.
label: sadness

text:
Knowing that I had to do the survey with him I felt very á
reluctant.  Although I do not know him I feel disgusted by just á
looking at him.  Thinking that the project lasted several days I á
regreted having joined that project.
label: disgust

text:
During the lesson the teacher called me and asked me if I had á
reported that I was late.  I pretended that I had but looking at á
her eyes I knew that she knew that I was lying.  I thought that á
it was really bad luck that she had examined the list of the á
students who were late.
label: shame

text:
That evening when I opened the songbook while I was singing the á
song "Those were the days" that guilt feeling became stronger.  á
The lyrics described well - I was really wrong.  The wish that I á
had made was really bad. If she were with me I would really be á
happy and we would play happily together like the days in á
secondary school and she would not be disappointed and gloomy á
because of me.
label: guilt

text:
When I learnt that I could do further studies at the Chinese á
university.
label: joy

text:
My best frieend left school recently.  The next day the weather á
turned bad suddenly and the male class-mates turned off the á
lights.  I remained on the table and was scared.
label: fear

text: I was scolded by my mother for no reason.
label: anger

label: sadness

text:
When I dined with my new friends	 one of them kept reminding us á
that he was superior.
label: disgust

While dining with some accquaintances I was asked something á
which I should have known but I did not know.
label: shame

My friend came to the concert for my sake as it was me who had á

label: guilt

Waiting for the results of the High level examination.  I was á

I had a date with a friend to see a movie and my friend was late. á
 I waited for a long hour and was very angry.
label: anger

text: The quarrel between my  parents.
label: sadness

text:
During the Chinese lessons a student often showed off. Moreover á

label: disgust

text:
I saw a bag on the street and just then a stranger passed by.  I á

thought that it belonged to him.  But it was not his bag and I á
felt ashamed.
label: shame

text: I refused to lend my homework to a friend.
label: guilt

label: joy

text:
Once	 before I had learnt to swim	 I stepped on a slippery slope á
where there was a lot of moss and I slipped into the water.  The á
water was very deep and I could not stand on my feet.  I sank á
and had to use a lot of energy.
label: fear

text: [ No response.]
label: anger

text: [ No response.]

text:
One day when I was sitting in a not very crowded bus	 a middle  á
aged woman was standing beside me.  The person sitting next to me á
got up to get off and this woman pushed me and occupied the seat. á
 Then she took off her shoes and put her feet on the seat.
label: disgust

text: [ No response.]
label: shame

text:
In 1983	 my results at the university entrance exam were very á
poor - far from what I had expected.   I thought that I would not á
be accepted at the university.
label: sadness

text:
I am disgusted by people who spoil their identity because of á
misbehaviour.  This morning when I was in a crowded bus	 I found á
a seat on which a university student was sitting on one side and á
he had put his bag and files next to him.  There was very little á
space left and I sat down while he kept on reading.  Even when I á
leaned on him he did not put his bag away.  He did not respond and á
I felt very angry.
label: disgust

text:
During a lecture six students (including me) were asked to leave á
the class as we had not prepared for the lesson.  I felt ashamed á
and angry.
label: shame

text:
One evening I went fishing with some friends but we could not á
fish as a fisherman had already put his net there.  We pulled á
out the net to find only crabs in it so we threw the net away.  á
The net was large and may have cost $1000.  The fisherman used á
the net to earn a living and we had had thrown it.
label: guilt

text:
I had a very close friend who went to Canada after her F.B	 his  á
departure was unavoidable.  When he came back during the Summer á
holidays I was very happy as nothing had changed between us.
label: joy

text:
The day before the university results came out I was both excited á
and scared.  If I failed I did not know what I would do as I did á
not want to work	 my family was ambivalent.
label: fear

text:
Before the certificate examination I was very poor in Biology á
(the worst result in my class).  Ever since F.5 it had been á
getting poorer and poorer.  I had tried my best and had spent á
most of my time studying this subject.  Finally my results were á
so bad that I thought that it was just not fair.
label: anger

text:
My cat died from an illness.  It had been with us for 7 years.  á
It was a lovely cat.  It had been ill for one or two weeks and á
the veterinary surgeon had told us that it was dying.
label: sadness

text:
In secondary school I had a class-mate who talked too much.   á
Once we went to the cinema after school and she sat next to me and á
commented the movie throughout  - very disgusting.
label: disgust

text:
Our teacher had invited us to lunch and once at the canteen we á
started introducing ourselves.  Two of the boys showed a lot of á
interest in knowing personal details and then they started á
talking about some activities held in the college.  I had little á
interest in those activities so I talked to another student á
sitting next to me as I was afraid that they would ask me á
questions on those activities.
label: shame

text:
My younger sister wanted to take classes to learn a musical á
instrument.  One Saturday morning my mother asked me to go with        á
her for the registration.  I did not want to go  so I said that á
there might be many bad people at the club.  As a resullt my á
sister was scolded by my mother.
label: guilt

text: When I could study at university.
label: joy

label: fear

text:
Before the department meeting my friend ate a dish that I had á
prepared for this meeting.
label: anger

text:
I had a very short term romance during the summer vacations.  When á
we first met I felt excited but I wanted to avoid him after we had met á
a few times and so I proposed that we stay apart	 I felt very á
sad then.
label: sadness

text:
I felt disgusted on seeing my boyfriend after our separation.  á
One day he was begging at the mass transit railway station and at á
that moment I hated him.
label: disgust

text: Acting in a play at the orientation camp made me feel timid.
label: shame

text: I made my boyfriend so unhappy and depressed that I feel guilty.
label: guilt

text:
My friend had organized a birthday party for me secretly	 I was á
very happy not so much for the presents but because they seemed á
to care for me.
label: joy

text:
My 80 year old grandfather underwent three successive operations á
during a single year.  The third operation was risky and I was á
scared that he would die and feared that my grandmother would be á
very sad.
label: fear

text:
My elder brother often criticizes my mother's cooking.  Once he á
did it very impolitely and lost his temper.  This made all of us á
very sad.  I was very angry and I scolded him.  He asked me not á
to interfere with what was his buisness.
label: anger

text:
When my grandfather died I was extremely sad.  However my family á
members did not have any special feelings	 they said that he was á
already 80 years old.
label: sadness

text:
I was an instructior in a youth organization.  Whenever we	 the á
instructors would have a meeting the advisor would be present.  á
He did not understand our worknig conditions but talked a lot á
and had a lot of outdated ideas.  Whenever we disagreed with him á
he was very discontent and said that we had a prejudice against á
him.  Why did he have to treat us as his subordinates ?
label: disgust

text:
When we received  our academic result I learnt that my  results á
were bad as I had not done my best.  The results of my á
accquaintances were good and when they asked me about my results á
I really did not want to answer.
label: shame

text:
When I was fighting with my elder brother I unintentionally hurt   á
him in the eye with a wooden bar.  I felt guilty and feared that á
he would be blind	 fortunately he recovered after 15 days.
label: guilt

text: I finished my homework; an important task.
label: joy

text:
Fear of the turn that the examination paper would take as I á
lacked confidence.
label: fear

text:
Mr C took my drawing pens	 without having asked for my permission á
first	 and lost them.  He did not tell me about it till I asked á
him and then did not try to find them.
label: anger

text:
When I learnt that I had to repeat the first year	 I found the á
solution immediately but was blocked by many difficulties.
label: sadness

text:
My girlfriend lost her temper without any reason and she did not á
consider or respect my feelings.
label: disgust

text:
After I had given the wrong answer to my students they pointed á
it out to me and I had to correct myself.
label: shame

text: I prayed unfaithfully.
label: guilt

text:
I am happpy when I get good results in the field of academics or á
athletics.
label: joy

text:
One day a fierce looking man came to our house  and said that my á
father should apologize to him	 however I was alone at home.
label: fear

text:
My cassmate laughed at me when I was being scolded by the á
teacher.
label: anger

text:
I knew a girl so lovely that everyone would like her.  But she á
refused to accept my Christmas present and I tried to forget á
her.
label: sadness

text:
I hate the behaviour of my so called friends	 they use bad á
language	 spit	 boast and treat the youngsters badly.
label: disgust

text:
When I was young my mother told the neighbour that I had wet the á
bed.  I felt ashamed thinking that the neighbour's children would á
get to know about it.
label: shame

text:
One day while we were strolling along the road one of my á
friends suggested that we go and watch a blue film.  I was á
curious so I went along but I felt quite guilty later.
label: guilt

text:
The day the results of the university entrance exam was á

label: joy

text:
One night we were having a barbecue on the beach and I needed to á
go to my car	 which was far away from the beach.  It was very á
dark as there were no street lamps.  I ran in the dark	 very á
scared	 I ran as fast as possible.
label: fear

text: [ No response.]
label: anger

text:
I separated with the one I liked most.  She refused all my dates á
and told me that she had dated another one.  My heart seemed to á
cease beating.  I was silent for some time and then I whispered á
goodbye and left without turning back.
label: sadness

text:
When I was a teacher in an evening school	 a girl raised a lot of á
questions and expressed her opinions.  She	 very often	 took a á
stand which was different from mine and she thought that it á
was better than mine.  Her opinions were helpful academically	 but  á
she did not take into consideration my position in public.  Also á
she seemed to be very talkative and so she disgusted me.
label: disgust

text:
I had lunch in a restaurant with a friend and I paid the bill.  á
The change was that of a two dollar and a ten cent coin.  As I á
was talking with my friend I took the two dollar coin and forgot á
to leave a tip.
label: shame

text:
I was cold to my sister without meaning it	 just because I was á
upset and frustated.
label: guilt

text: When I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.
label: joy

text:
After the interview for admission to the university and before á
the admission list was disclosed.  I was scared that I would not á
be admitted and my fear lasted for quite some time.  My fear á
disappeared only after the list was disclosed.
label: fear

text:
When I was studying in the library - preparing for a test	 two á
people sitting next to me talked to each other for 20 minutes.  á
There were no other seats so I could not go elsewhere and I did   á
not want to interrupt them	 so I could only be angry in my heart.
label: anger

text:
I had been separated from my girlfriend for about a year.  On her á
birthday I put a present in her mailbox.  I had spent two days á
choosing a suitable present for her.  I waited for a few days and á
there was no reply from her; at last I received a thank-you card á
in my mailbox.  On the card there was only my name	 the words thank-you  á
and her signature.  I was very sad then.
label: sadness

text:
When I was travelling to school by bus	 I went past a place á
where a sewer had been repaired.  There was a bad strong smell á
which suffocated me and I wanted to leave the place immediately.
label: disgust

text:
I received the results of the test paper of my major subject and á
I found that my result was not as good as a classmate who had á
recently changed his major subject.    I felt very ashamed.
label: shame

text:
I had promised myself that I would do one good deed every day.  á
One night I saw a beggar whose muscles had been atrophyed.  I á
walked passed him thinking that he was feigning.  Later I á
realized that he had not been pretending and I had a feeling of á
guilt as I had not kept my promise.
label: guilt

text:
Talkiing about the past happy hours with two friends at night in á
a camp a few months ago.  We shared our feelings	 notions and á
every hidden anxiety.  I thought that they cared for me and I á
was very happy and satified.
label: joy

text:
I remember that my form 2 teacher was very fierce and dogmatic.  á
My feet would tremble whenever I saw her but I had to face the fact that á
I had to go for her class.
label: fear

text:
One night I could not practise my violin as my family was á
watching T.V with the lights off	 so I wanted to listen to some á
tapes.  It was dark so I asked my brother to bring me a torch	 á
however he scolded me.  I was so angry that I slammed my violin á
on the floor.
label: anger

text:
My mother suffers from a mental illness.  One night she was not á
feeling well and was sent to the hospital.  I was scared that á
she would die	 and all night I was very sad and did not dare to á
close my eyes.
label: sadness

text:
At the crowded conditions of living.  I always quarrel with my á
elder brother as he puts the T.V volume at a deafening level and á
I can not practise my piano lessons.  Thus I feel that my home is á
disgusting.
label: disgust

text:
I lost my temper at my mother while she was teaching me.  I felt á
ashamed and sorry at having hurt my loving mother.
label: shame

text:
I felt guilty at not having practised the piano.  I waste my á
teacher's time and guidance.
label: guilt

text:
I watched a football match with my old friend.  The performance á
of the team was very good and the team members were full of á
spirit.  The match was excellent and every time a goal was scored á
I felt excited.
label: joy

text:
When I got the midterm exam results	 the results were below á
average and were near the lowest.  I was scared of the final á

label: fear

text:
When I came back to my hostel	 my bed was full of newspapers and á
dirty clothes.  My room-mate asked me to wash the clothes for him á
as he had no time (this was his responsibility).  The food we á
shared had been eaten up by him (I ate little).
label: anger

text:
My sister was impolite to my father when the family was having á
lunch together at a restaurant.  She thought that our parents had á
been prejudiced against her	 this was an extreme thought.
label: sadness

text:
When I was giving private tutorials to my student; he would not á
concentrate and was lazy.  He had not done the home work that I  á
had assigned and his academic level was very low.  It was a á
nuisance.
label: disgust

text:
During a meeting I said something wrong and the others laughed at á
me.
label: shame

text:
I entered the hostel this year.  My mother was ill and could not á
move and needed people to look after her.  Every week I left home á
to go back to school	 I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text: I received a letter from a friend whom I was missing
label: joy

text:
I feared that I would not be able to hand in the book-report on á
time as I had started working very late.  The book was difficult á
to read and my teacher did not accept my work as it was handed in á
late.
label: fear

text:
My classmate always borrowed my notes and would not return it to á
me on time.  When I had a test she was selfish and irresponsible á
and so delayed my studies.
label: anger

text: When I found that my coldness had hurt somebody's sincerity.
label: sadness

text: When I was studying and someone disturbed me.
label: disgust

text:
My teacher said that being university studets we did not have á
any self-initiative or self-control.
label: shame

text: I took french leave to do my homework.
label: guilt

text:
I realized that a fellow member had grown spiritually.  I was the á
leader of a spiritual group and had prayed for him.  He did not á
want to burn the incense but his mother forced him to do it.  á
Finally his mother told him that he could discontinue if he got á
good results at school.
label: joy

text: Looking for the toilet in a dark place.
label: fear

text:
I gave tutorial to a student and I found that he was lazy	 he did á
not pay attention to what I taught.  He did some easy questions á
wrong deliberately.
label: anger

text: I saw a lot of starving people in a T.V news report.
label: sadness

text: Our neighbour came and gossiped	 about others	 with my parents.
label: disgust

text:
I promised a friend that I would return a book to it's owner for á
him 	 but I forgot to do it.
label: shame

text: Saw a blue film in a cinema.
label: guilt

text:
When I saw the certificate results	 I did not feel very happy as I á
did not realize that I had got all the credits until my á
classmates pointed it out to me.  My parents and my relatives á
praised me and I realized that my results were good i.e 2A	 5B	 á
2C.  I felt satisfied with the results and was happy.
label: joy

text:
An hour before receiving the certificate results I was very á
frightened.  When I saw others crying I felt very tense and as á
time went by my fear grew.
label: fear

text:
My classmate used her personal relations to get a seat for a á
subject that I wanted also.  I had taken the pains to help him á
apply and I did not get selected.  I did not like this as he had á
not told me the facts earlier	 he need not have lied to me.
label: anger

text:
When my mother went through an operation	 it was not very serious á
but I was sad and could not sleep before the operation.
label: sadness

text:
During a recent meeting	 Mr. A showed his excitement and á
overindulged in the notes delivered.  Though his curiosity could á
not be blamed	 his way of accquiring knowledge was an extreme á
behaviour e.g he always tried to know what I was reading and á
gained everything he could.
label: disgust

text:
When I was doing my homework at home	 some relatives came and á
advised me to help my mother do the house-work.
label: shame

text:
While quarreling with my brother I broke the glass door of the á
cupboard and a china doll.  We were scolded by my father for á
breaking the door but we did not tell him about the door.
label: guilt

text: When I was admitted to the Chinese universiity.
label: joy

text: An inter-college basket-ball match.
label: fear

text: Something was stolen.
label: anger

text: When I learnt that my close friend was going to immigrate.
label: sadness

text: When the summer holiday job was almost over.
label: disgust

text: During a meeting.
label: shame

text: Failed to keep an appointment.
label: guilt

text: When I told my girlfriend a joke openly and frankly.
label: joy

text: Once while crossing a road I was overcome with fear.
label: fear

text:
My intimate girlfriend told me that her father was opposed to our á
relationship  and had insulted my integrity.
label: anger

text: When my studies are too demanding and I cannot cope with it.
label: sadness

text: The behaviour of people spitting everywhere.
label: disgust

text: I could not finish my homework on time.
label: shame

text: After masturbation.
label: guilt

text: When I finished the work that I had planned to do - my homework.
label: joy

text:
I was not prepared for the exam but I wanted to sleep the night á
before the exam.
label: fear

text: Someone played a trick on me.
label: anger

text:
When the thing that made my friends and relatives sad happened to á
them.
label: sadness

text:
It was a narrow and dirty passage which was located near the á
market and I had to stand there to wait for people.
label: disgust

text:
I had something wrong	 saying wrong things and being impolite to á
someone	 and this had embarrassed the this person.  And I á
still meet the person.
label: shame

text: I said something which was against my conscience.
label: guilt

text:
Several good friends made me a surprise visit and this made me á
happy.  They are my closest friends and we had not seen each á
other for a long time.
label: joy

text:
The hero was chased by a terrible vampire in a suspense and á
horror film shown on T.V.
label: fear

text:
I worked with several classmates on a project.  I was very á
anxious about the project while my partners showed no concern  á
and when we had meetings on the project my classmates  did not á
pay any attention.  Some of them read books while the others á
argued on irrelevant questions.  The meeting would go on for two á
hours without the main theme being discussed.  We wasted time and á
could not reach a compromise.  My classmates avoided doing the á
work and the responsibilities	 they seemed to value other á
projects more than this one.
label: anger

text:
One of my good friends had to migrate to America.  Our friendship á
had developed quite well and it was a pity as our friendship would á
fade.
label: sadness

text:
In a study group	 a person always liked to argue on some á
unimportant	 irrelevant and minor points.  He tried to persuade    á
others in an unfriendly way.  He was obstinate and would not accept  á
other's point of view.
label: disgust

text:
Once my presentation was the worst among my classmates as I had á
not prepared it well and had not seen it as important.  My á
presentation was so confused that it clearly showed my poor á
preparation.
label: shame

text:
I joked with an unfamiliar friend in an obstinate tone.  I was á
afraid of his misunderstanding me and being hurt and angry at me. á
 I felt sorry over my conduct and thought that I had to find an á
opportunity to apologize.
label: guilt

text:
I remember my religious experience.  During  a gospel camp	 a few á
friends of mine decided to believe in God.  The joy that I felt á
at that time was more than words can express.  I blessed them and á
praised God in my heart.
label: joy

text:
My friend and I had offended our classmate unintenionally.  We á
wanted to apologize to her so we decided to visit her.  We knew that she á
was stubborn so we were frightened.  When we rang her door bell	 á
our fear was at it's climax
label: fear

text:
My girlfriend disliked it when I played majong (a game of gambling).  á
I expressed my regrets and when I went to see her she neglected my á
existance.  I was very angry and left in displeasure.
label: anger

text:
When I said good-bye to my girlfriend.  I had spent two years on á
developing this relationship and it was unsuccessful	 I felt very á
sad.
label: sadness

text:
My classmate got a "B" for his homework while I only got a "C".  á
When we got the results he acted as if he did not merit this á
grade.  I found that his humility was hypocritical and I found it á
disgusting.
label: disgust

text:
Once in primary five	 I had forgotten to take a book to class and á
the teacher punished me by asking me to stand at the back of the á
class.  I thought about the way my mother would react if she saw á
me being punished.  My mother was very good to me and though she á
did not see me punished	 I felt sorry for her.
label: shame

text:
I had fixed a meeting with my classmates and I missed it as I was á
tired.  Besides everyone at the meeting was a stranger to me and á
I did not want to make friends with them.  Whatever the reasons - I  á
felt guilty.
label: guilt

text:
I learnt from the newspaper that I had been accepted at the á
Chinese university of H.K.  It was 7 o'clock in the morning.  á
Later I told my family and relatives about it and had tea with á
them very joyfully.
label: joy

text:
I was camping in an old broken hut which had no lights.  I had á
brought along a lamp which was not working very well.  The door á
made strange sounds and I was sure that strange things were á
happening.  The most terrifying bit was that there were many á
wardrobes in the hut and everytime that I looked in the glass of á
the wardrobe I felt that there were "objects" behind me.   The á
whole night was spent in fear and restlessness.
label: fear

text:
During a football match	 the other team was rude and they hurt my á
team members and me.  The coach was prejudiced against us and á
punished us unreasonably.  Later we fought with each other and á
the match had to be cut short.
label: anger

text:
I heard of the death of a closefriend of mine.  I had gone camping        á
with him shortly before his death and the whole thing seemed very  á
sudden to me.
label: sadness

text:
A  group of youngsters dressed in fads talked foul language on a á
bus.  They also insulted the  pedestrians on the road and were á
impolite to the passengers of the bus.
label: disgust

text:
In a Christian gathering's lucky draw I mistook a girl's name for á
mine (a boy's name).  I realized my mistake only when I went up á
to the stage for the prize.  I did not know what to do as á
everyone was looking at me.  I blushed and went back to my seat.
label: shame

text:
While playing basketball I broke a team member's spectacles.  His á
face was injured by the  pieces of glass.  It was not serious but á
I felt guilty and blamed myself for being too careless and á
vigorous in my game.
label: guilt

text:
After a busy day I went back to my hostel.  I closed the door and á
had a drink	 then I read my favourite book on the bed.  Suddenly á
I felt peace and joy.
label: joy

text:
When I went home and there was nobody	 I waited till 2 A.M and      á
still nobody.  I was suddenly scared and anxious as this had never á
happened before.  In addition my mother was very weak and I á
feared that she had met with an accident.  Therefore I was anxious  á
all night.
label: fear

text:
Yesterday I read in the newspaper that a 30 year old woman had á
abused her 2 month old son and had caused his death.  I was very á
angry after reading this as this is not a human act and to abuse á
so fragile a life is not a forgivable sin.
label: anger

text:
I had a schoolmate who went to the hospital as her brain was á
bleeding.  She fell unconscious for three days and when I went á
to see her I saw the miserable state the family was in.  Moreover á
I could not do nothing for her.  I was very sad.  Finally	 she á
died.
label: sadness

text:
A tiresome person held me up all day long.  I was very busy then á
(I can not remember what the problem was).  He continously tried á
to make me talk to him and disturbed me.
label: disgust

text:
One day	 when I was sitting on the bus	 there was an old woman á
standing beside me.  I was very tired and sleepy and did not á
think of giving her my seat.  A 50 year old woman who was sitting á
beside me got up and gave her seat to the old woman and said	  á
" Old woman	 please take my seat	 the youngstters these days are á
not used to giving their seats to others."  When I heard these á
words I was very ashamed of myself and wanted to get off the bus á
at once.
label: shame

text:

text:
Our class had organized a picnic in November.  I was the class á

Initially I did not ponder on what to do and decided to go for á

 I was very angry as there were other prefects sitting and he á

Before getting into the bus I had prepared the exact amount of á

text:
